My heart is so heavy. We lost a beautiful soul this week. Nicole lit up every room she walked into. On and off the stage she was a constant source of joy and positivity. Some things feel so unfair and we will never understand why they happen. What I do know is that we were blessed to laugh with her, to travel with her, and to experience her infectious smile and love for a life filled with music. Nicole, it’s not enough to say that I am going to miss you dearly. Thank you for your light. I will do my best to carry that with me. I love you, my sister. Forever family and forever a TN Kid. 💔

Memphis is my hometown and I’ve always had a lot of pride in that... the people, the music, the food, and the culture. But what most DON’T know about this city is that it that sits on top of some of the world’s cleanest drinking water. It serves over a million local residents. But now that drinking water is at risk because oil companies are planning to build the #ByhaliaPipeline. This pipeline will run through predominantly Black, low-income neighborhoods. This cannot happen. Today, on #EarthDay, please consider what we are doing to the planet AND the people when we destroy sources of clean drinking water simply for the profit of two large companies. Watch to learn more about this and please support the good people of Memphis, by signing the petition in my bio. (Note: the petition is NOT a donation page, just a place to gather signatures to raise awareness on this issue). 🙏🏻 #MemphisStrong

Gotta give Memphis a moment here. It’s my hometown, but it’s also a big part of music history and American history. @StaxMuseum is home to the greatest hits of Otis Redding — it’s also, sadly, where we lost Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in 1968. Felt fitting to celebrate this new administration here. Our song BETTER DAYS is out now... with a special version including a message by Gospel Legend @KirkFranklin. Link in my bio (and stories) to get it.

Special thanks again to the students and alumni of @staxmusicacademy for being part of the inaugural performance last night. I’ve been working with the students here for years now, and they never cease to amaze. Loved every second of being here, singing with you guys in our hometown for such a big night. 🙏🏻 @antclemons @bideninaugural @staxmuseum

Today we all watched @joebiden and @kamalaharris take office — and make history. Tonight, @antclemons and I are deeply honored to perform our new song, BETTER DAYS, as a celebration of everything this administration represents... as well as a reminder to keep our eyes on the road ahead. We have a lot of work to do, but I’m feeling very hopeful for this country right now. A huge thank you to my friends, students and alumni at @staxmusicacademy for performing with us on your grounds in our hometown of Memphis. This is a very special place to me, because it exists to nurture the next generation of great soul communicators. And if we’ve learned anything this year, it’s that this new generation of voices is powerful and crucial to creating much needed change. I hope you all enjoy the performance, and I hope, more than anything, that this song brings a little bit of joy as we move forward. 🙏🏻

What a day. As we celebrate a new administration, and our first Madam Vice President — we also celebrate ALL the women who paved the way for us. Coincidentally, it’s my mom’s 60th today. Send her some love! I am forever grateful for your constant support (and your cinnamon sugar toast) @lynnharless. Happy birthday, I love you! 🙏🏻

Celebrating the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. today — and thinking about the message he would have for this country right now, as we countdown to a new administration.

While he spoke about peace and progress - he also talked about responsibility, allyship... and beyond that, real partnership. “Constructive social change will bring certain tranquility: evasions will merely encourage turmoil. [The Black community] holds only one key to the double lock of peaceful change. The other is in the hands of the white community.” 

We all need to do our part to continue working towards the change that #MLK fought for and was killed for. Because, as he said... there is no other answer.
“Your screen time has gone up by 1,000% this week to an estimated total of 25 hours in two days.” Zoom Zoom for #Palmer @appletv

A few months ago, during lockdown, @antclemons and I wrote a song together called BETTER DAYS. (I actually recorded my final vocals for this song on election night...) ⠀
⠀
This past year brought a lot of frustration, grief, anger — and there were times  when it was easy to feel powerless. This song was our way of doing what little we could to encourage everyone to stay hopeful... and keep working towards a better, more equal future. ⠀
⠀
I’m very honored to announce we will be performing this song on January 20th for the Presidential Inauguration. We have a long way to go to fix, undo, and rebuild this country... but I hope now, despite the past four years, we are on our way. #Inauguration2021

This man was always so kind to me. He had the best stories about legendary moments in @dodgers baseball history and the best stories about life. He had the type of personality that could light up a room — and when he spoke, you could hear a pin drop... A true 1 of 1. My stepdad, Paul was always a big fan and on one of his birthdays my good friend @boyfromnewyorkcity helped me surprise him with a dinner with Mr. Lasorda (he insisted I call him Tommy. I still always called him Mr. Lasorda). He shows up at my apartment in NYC and told my stepdad (who was awestruck) all the stories behind their legendary wins and losses, and his amazing career. He stayed far longer than I could ever have asked for and was so happy to be there and put a Cheshire Cat smile on my stepdad’s face. This, maybe the most, spoke to his heart and character because I’ve heard so many stories like my own about his generosity and humility. ⠀
⠀
This pic is from backstage at SNL on one of the weeks I was hosting. He wanted to come and see me rehearse and in my element and I was truly honored.⠀
⠀
A real legend and one hell of a man.⠀
⠀
I feel lucky to have shared time with you Mr. “Tommy” Lasorda. I’m sure you’re already raising a little bit of hell up there...⠀

Tonight @antclemons and I performed our new song “Better Days” for @staceyabrams’ Rock The Runoff virtual concert in support of @fairfightaction. We wrote the song together during the lockdown as a reaction to the frustrations and challenges we’ve all been hit with this year... but also as a reminder to stay hopeful and continue working toward a better future. All proceeds from tonight’s event went towards Fair Fight’s incredible work to fight voter suppression and ensure every Georgian can be a part of the January 5 runoff election. This state election is gonna play a crucial role in moving our country forward - and we are not helpless in this fight.

To get involved or get more info — go to fairfight.com (link in my bio), and encourage your friends in Georgia to turn out for this election 🙏🏻 #BETTERDAYS

I think I was 19 here. That would have been 2000... when I spent a lot more time in the gym 😂 It was also around the first time I voted. I just remember thinking voting was cool, and it all felt very... adult — I don’t think I really understood the weight of it all or took the time to learn what my choices in candidates really meant. ⠀
⠀
Now, I know how powerful each of our voices can be.  ⠀
⠀
If you’re voting for the first time, or you’re still not sure if you even wanna vote — because you think your voice won't make an impact, or you don't trust the process, or it all seems just like a headache... all I can say is, we really need you. ⠀
⠀
This is about our children growing up in a world where racism is condemned, not tolerated. It’s about ensuring that women are empowered everywhere decisions are being made. We have to vote so we don’t go backwards.   ⠀
⠀
All of this to say, I will be voting for @joebiden and @kamalaharris. I’m voting early, and by mail this year.  ⠀
⠀
Please make a plan, and #VOTE 🙏🏻 Link in my bio.

...a state that happens to be the home of many many confederate monuments. I’ve been listening closely to the ongoing debates about what to do with these statues — and I really want to take a minute to talk about this. ⠀
⠀
When we protest racism in America, people think we are protesting America itself. Why is that the reaction? Because America was built by men who believed in and benefitted from racism. Plain and simple. ⠀
⠀
This is when you hear “But that’s all in the past”. So let’s be clear... those men who proudly owned and abused Black people are STILL celebrated all over the country. ⠀
⠀
There are roughly 1,848 confederate statues of in the US. More than half are in The South, and it’s not acceptable. No one should be protecting the legacies of confederate leaders and slave owners. 
⠀
If we plan to move forward, these monuments must come down. But let’s remember: Removing these statues does not erase our country’s vile history of oppression — removing them is a symbol of respect for Black people in America and it’s a step towards progress and actual equality for all. ⠀
⠀
This video is by @aclu_nationwide, which has been fighting hard to remove these statues across the country. Their Legal Director #JeffreyRobinson has been speaking on this issue for years (you can find more in the link in my bio). Please follow them and learn more about the history of the monuments in your own states and counties.

Boys grow up to be fathers. I think about that a lot these days. We try to teach our son to love and to respect everyone — we teach him that all people are all created equal, and that no one should be treated differently because of the color of their skin. We teach him this because one day, he will go on to teach his kids the same. It’s a cycle. And right now, as we all work to undo generations of discrimination that have plagued our system and our communities across this country... I’m reminded today that the first lessons start at home. Im grateful for both of my dads and my mother for teaching me those lessons from the beginning. And for listening to me when I had something to say that they hadn’t learned. I pray for that humility with my own son. I’m grateful for my wife, who made me a father, and is my favorite person/partner/teacher/friend in all of it. I’m grateful for my son, who is always ALWAYS teaching me right back. ⠀
⠀
Happy Father’s Day to all the Dads out there. While we owe our sons and daughters these lessons in the places where the doors close at night, I hope you are as inspired as I am to make them THE TRUTH in the places that same door opens every morning and we send them out to discover. There’s more to do. And we are built for it. After all, we are the Dads. Sending my love to you and yours.

Those of us who call ourselves allies need to do everything in our power to stand with the black community right NOW. BLACK people are regularly being murdered unjustly by police. We have seen it. Over and over again. This has gone on in America for too long, and it’s NEVER been okay. We have to take action, we have to make noise.⠀
⠀
For seven whole minutes, #GeorgeFloyd pleaded for his life, while Derek Chauvin, one of Minneapolis cops involved, kneeled on his neck and ignored those pleas for help.⠀
⠀
Allies... this is the time for us all to take a hard look in the mirror, share responsibility and ask our family and friends what can we do to educate our own communities. ⠀
⠀
I stand with @ColorOfChange and countless others across the country to raise my voice alongside you, and demand that all FOUR officers involved are arrested and charged with murder now. Text FLOYD to 55156. Sign the petition. Don’t stop.

You will always be one of my biggest idols. You taught me so much about how to keep it simple and real. I felt such a kinship with you even before we met. Your words and melodies... the chords that accompanied them... they reached into my soul and spoke to me so deeply. That’s what your music did. It brought so many of us closer to you and to each other. And, to actually know you was truly something special. You shined a light that was so unique and warm. I looked up to you the same way I looked up to my Poppa... and he was my favorite human in the world. You have always been one of the greatest and will forever be. I will miss your jokes and I will never forget your advice to me about music... “How does it make you FEEL? That’s the only question you have to answer.”⠀
⠀
Rip Mr. Withers. One of a kind.⠀

We met when we were both teenagers and bonded over our drive and process. I was in awe of what you could do with a basketball and knew your talent went beyond your physical gifts and stretched to your mentality. A mentality that I would take with me throughout my whole career and still use every day. As the years went by, I watched you do things that seemed humanly unimaginable. And, through ups and downs, championships and injuries, you still remained with an unwavering resolve about your mentality to remain fierce to competition. But, every time we would speak or text, something started to change... your patience and ease grew. And it inspired me to continue to grow for myself. Years passed, and the “old man” jokes would start to be traded back and forth. We both appreciated a good “ribbing.” We joked about “The Vino Club.” You nicknamed yourself ‘Vino’ to represent how one could age gracefully as a fine wine does. But, you never stopped aiming to inspire me. Your confidence in me was huge - it really affected me because I admired you so much. I don’t mean as one of the greatest athletes ever. I mean as a person. People sometimes can confuse a will to win with a lack of compassion. That wasn’t you. You had both qualities. The last conversation that we shared was about being fathers and what that meant. That was, beyond all the things that we could do in this world, our true legacy. Who our children are and what beautiful people they will become. And, I guess right now, without being able to find all the words, THAT father connection is what is most devastating for me. I am sending my love to Vanessa and your family and to the families of everyone connected in the mourning of this terrible tragedy. My heart is broken and my family lifts you up in our thoughts and prayers. 
Kobe... You have connected so many of us. The Mamba Mentality will last for all of time. I know that will be a source for me every day as it has been for so many days before. Your legacy is with us. It’s our responsibility to pass it down now. I hope I can continue to make you proud, Vino. Champ, MVP, Legend, Hero, Inspiration, Father, Friend. I’m gonna miss you, brother. Mamba forever.

FBF and a MAJOR appreciation and congratulations post to this dynamic duo... Go back to the year 2001 when a young man was stepping out on his own and finding out who he was through his own voice and his own music. These two geniuses not only helped me find my identity but would be mentors and inspirers of my songwriting for years to come and still are some of my favorite collaborators. To P and Chad: you changed my life and will always be two of my heroes. And you are still doing it at that level. Kudos to the @SongwritersHOF for recognizing two artists who changed the landscape of music as we know it. And, congrats to #TheNeptunes!!! No One Ever Really Dies... 🖖🏻

I brought some friends in for #TROLLSWorldTour, and I’m so proud of the movie... and the music... and all the people who jumped on board. Figuring out how to crack a song with guys like @anderson._paak, @ludwiggoransson and @jamesfauntleroyii is really why I got into this in the first place. Literally nothing better. Wanted to give you guys a glimpse of the whole process before it all comes out, so here you go... I’m excited to say there’s A LOT more where this came from 🙌

This is what happens when your wife admits on TV that she doesn’t know any NSYNC songs.

That one hurt. I know first hand how music can impact the way kids learn... So I teamed up with @levis to launch the Levis Music Project — and open a songwriting class and a fully equipped studio space for the students of @staxmusicacademy in my hometown. Big thanks to @timbaland, @theonlydanja, @robknox_, and @soirodgers for coming with us and working with the students on their music. And special thanks to our partners who donated and made this all possible: @shure @gibsonguitar @guitarcenter @nativeinstruments @uaudio @korgofficial @voxamplification @blackstaramps

While the rescue and relief efforts continue in the Bahamas, I’m joining the One Bahamas Fund (with @tigerwoods, @rbc, and @albanybahamas) to help raise money and support for the restoration and rebuilding of this island and its community. The damage and devastation the residents are facing after #HurricaneDorian is unfathomable so we’re matching dollar for dollar the the next $6 million raised. If you give $1 we’ll match it so we can hopefully turn that $6 million into $12 million, together.

The Bahamas is a really special place to me. I’ve spent a lot of time there over the years, both with my family and in the studio  so I want to do all I can to help and I hope you will too.

Please repost, spread the word, and give if you can. Link up top. 🙏

The last 3 years of my life have brought more joy than I could ever imagine. Being a father is such a trip... an amazing discovery every day. My son: it is my honor to be your Daddy. You make me feel a love that I didn't know existed. I will ALWAYS be there... to pick you up when you fall, to lift you up when you are ready to soar, and to remind you that your humility will be your guide through this thing called life. And to all the Dads out there: Keep on keeping on! Our children are watching and listening more than we know! I'm celebrating you all today! Happy Father's Day! Cheers! 🍻

“In this industry, for the things we uphold and we love and we treasure and we respect, we have to get involved. I stand up here on the shoulders of all the beautiful people who inspired me. So like all of the people that came before us, it is our duty to make sure that not only are we making the greatest art, we uphold and support each other and the things that are super real.” -JAY-Z. 
So inspired by Jay’s words from last night’s pre-Grammy party (Congrats HOV!!) and it reminded me of times like this. I wish I could be there to support all of the artists on what will undoubtedly be a special night tonight. Sending love to the nominees, performers and everyone there! #Grammys

Today and every day, it is so important to respect and honor those who have served. This week, my wife @jessicabiel and I had the honor of supporting @Heroesandhorses, dedicated to veterans’ rehabilitation. Started by Navy SEAL combat veteran Micah Fink, this 40-day program uses horses and remote wilderness to bridge the gap between challenge and purpose in the lives of America’s combat veterans. Watch the full film @500milesproject in the link up top. I hope it moves you as much as it did me. And go to www.heroesandhorses.org/500-miles to find out more. 
THANK YOU to all those who have served our country. God bless our veterans. #VeteransDay 🇺🇸

First tournament I ever played in... He looked this young man in the eye and introduced himself. You could feel the GREATNESS surrounding him. I was in awe. A few months later, I ran into him on the driving range at Bay Hill with a pitching wedge in my hand and he sat and helped me with my swing (despite his best efforts, I still need all the help I can get...) He changed the game forever. He defined what the modern athlete is. He flew his own plane to his tournaments. He STARTED a network JUST for the sport. He won spectacularly. He lost graciously. He was bigger than the game. And, he was one of the nicest men I have ever met.

I liked the game of golf when I met him. And, HE made me love it. Mr. Palmer, you will be missed by so many avid fans but you will forever be the remembered as THE KING. The definition of a LEGEND.

R.I.P.

Love,

JT

Last night -  in celebration of pride- a group of people - people like you or me or your neighbors or family were dancing & listening to music & celebrating life, just like you or me or your neighbors would. And then, one man and his guns took that life away from them. That's cruel. And it's exactly against what America stands for. I try to make music that hopefully brings joy to people and makes people dance and makes people feel and makes people LOVE... Because there's nothing more pure and beautiful than that act- and the fact that that resulted in the largest mass shooting in American history leaves me heartbroken. I used to LIVE there. I hope we can wake up and realize we are ALL THE SAME. Just humans. One species. Just wanting to be LOVED.

#PrayForOrlando #MoreLoveLessHate

It was Raspberry Beret. I was 4 years old. Yes, 4. I remember that I instantly loved it. "Mommy, who is that singing?" Seems weird but it's true. 
More than a "once in a lifetime" artist... Just a ONCE IN FOREVER ARTIST. I'm still in shock as I write this and I feel this overwhelming grief. But, we should all turn away from that and HONOR this musician that changed all of our lives, our perspectives, our feeling, our whole being. From another planet? Probably. Royalty, for sure. Us worthy..? Laughable.

They say don't meet your idols... That they let you down. But, some of my greatest, funniest (yes, he was hilarious), and most prolific encounters and conversations about music came from the moments that I spent with him. It would be silly to say that he has inspired our music... It's beyond that. He's somewhere within every song I've ever written. 
I am sad, but I will smile when I think of every second that I had the fortune of being in his company. We have lost our greatest living musician. But his music will never die. 
Prince, NOTHING COMPARES...
#RIPPrince

On February 21st, 2010... I had the blessing of meeting and spending time with this man before his show at the Rosemont Theatre in Chicago, IL. He let me photograph him backstage a couple of hours before he went onstage to a beloved crowd and took them to CHURCH. I got him to laugh at a joke at this very moment... My Grandfather was one of his hugest fans, as am I, so this was a very special day for me. The Country Music World has lost a LEGEND and a hell of a man.

#RIPMerleHaggard

A few months ago I had the pleasure of acting in a film directed by @itsmomcrae. Up to that point, we didn’t know each other personally.⁣
⁣
As often happens, before production began, Mo and I got to know each other a bit over a series of phone calls and FaceTime chats discussing the film. ⁣
⁣
Throughout production we continued to talk about all of those things but also about life and family. We are different men, but we hold the same values and have similar approaches to many things in life. ⁣
⁣
The world is in a dark place. Mo and I were talking about that on the phone just a day or two ago. As we continued to talk he mentioned that he had written a few thoughts of his own down and that he had filmed it. It’s thoughtful, thought provoking, sad and very real. It’s something we should all watch. It’s something we should all rewatch. ⁣
⁣
I’m very proud of my friend for taking his time to be vulnerable in writing these words down — and for sharing. I stand with and support him.
#blackouttuesday

Canada stands united with our European allies in support of Ukraine – and in support of democracy and human rights everywhere. In my meetings with Prime Minister @borisjohnsonuk and @minpres Rutte today, we worked on our coordinated responses to Russia’s unprovoked and unjustifiable attacks. We’ll continue to work together to make sure Russia’s blatant violations of international law do not go unpunished.
🇨🇦
Le Canada unit ses forces à celles de ses alliés européens à l’appui de l’Ukraine ainsi que de la démocratie et des droits de la personne partout dans le monde. Lors de mes rencontres avec le premier ministre @borisjohnsonuk et le @minpres Rutte, aujourd’hui, nous avons travaillé à nos réponses concertées aux attaques non provoquées et injustifiables de la Russie. Nous allons continuer de travailler tous ensemble pour que la Russie subisse les conséquences de ses flagrantes violations du droit international.

Canada’s support for Ukraine and its people will never waver – that was my message to the members of the Ukrainian community whom I sat down with this afternoon.
🇨🇦
Le soutien du Canada à l’Ukraine et à sa population ne fléchira jamais. C’est le message que j’ai adressé aux membres de la communauté ukrainienne avec lesquels je me suis entretenu cet après midi.

Good afternoon from Mississauga – where we announced support for three new public transit projects. These projects will improve the public transit system across the city, shorten commutes, create good, middle class jobs, and cut air pollution. These are real results for the people of Mississauga, and we’ll continue to deliver for them and Canadians right across the country.
🇨🇦
Je vous salue depuis Mississauga – où on a annoncé du soutien pour trois nouveaux projets de transport en commun. Ces projets vont permettre d’améliorer le réseau de transport en commun partout dans la ville, d’abréger la durée des trajets quotidiens, de créer de bons emplois pour la classe moyenne et de réduire la pollution de l’air. Ce sont des résultats concrets pour les gens de Mississauga, et on va continuer à produire des résultats pour eux et pour les Canadiens d’un bout à l’autre du pays.

Good news for small- and medium-sized businesses: We’re launching the Canada Digital Adoption Program to help you grow your online presence and meet your customers’ needs in the digital marketplace. This morning in Ottawa, Minister @Mary_Ng and I announced the program – which will help make sure you and your business have the digital tools you need to succeed, grow, and create good jobs for the middle class. To put it simply: Small business owners have been incredibly resilient over the past two years, and we’ll continue to be there for them as we recover from this pandemic and adapt to new ways of doing business.
🇨🇦
Bonne nouvelle pour les petites et moyennes entreprises : on lance le Programme canadien d’adoption du numérique pour vous aider à accroître votre présence en ligne et à répondre aux besoins de vos clients dans le marché numérique. Ce matin, à Ottawa, la ministre @Mary_Ng et moi avons annoncé le programme, grâce auquel vous et votre entreprise aurez les outils numériques nécessaires pour réussir, croître et créer de bons emplois pour la classe moyenne. En termes simples, les propriétaires de petites entreprises ont été incroyablement résilients au cours des deux dernières années, et on va continuer d’être là pour eux pendant qu’on se remet de la pandémie et qu’on adopte de nouvelles façons de faire des affaires.

No matter what, this guy always knows how to put a smile on our faces. I can’t believe it’s his birthday again already… bonne fête, Hadrien! Je t’aime.
🇨🇦
Quoi qu’il arrive, ce gars-là trouve toujours une façon de nous faire sourire. Je ne peux pas croire que c’est déjà son anniversaire… bonne fête, Hadrien! Je t’aime.

Canadians stand with the people of Ukraine.
🇨🇦🇺🇦
Les Canadiens sont solidaires de la population ukrainienne.

In my meeting with G7 leaders and the Secretary General of NATO, during my conversation with President Zelenskyy of Ukraine, and in my address to Canadians this afternoon, my message was clear: Canada’s support for the sovereignty of Ukraine – and for the freedom of the Ukrainian people – is unwavering. That’s why, following Russia’s brutal and brazen attacks, we’re taking further action. We’re imposing new and severe sanctions on those responsible, and we’re halting all new export permit applications for Russia and cancelling existing permits. In addition, we’re urgently issuing travel documents for affected Canadians, permanent residents, and their immediate family members. And we’re prioritizing immigration applications for Ukrainians who want to come to Canada. Bottom line: Canada will not stand idly by while Russia commits acts of aggression and violates international law.
🇨🇦
Pendant ma rencontre avec les dirigeants du G7 et le secrétaire général de l’OTAN, lors de ma conversation avec le président de l’Ukraine, M. Zelenskyy, et dans mon allocution aux Canadiens cet après-midi, mon message était clair : le soutien du Canada à la souveraineté de l’Ukraine et à la liberté du peuple ukrainien est inébranlable. C’est pourquoi, à la suite des attaques brutales et effrontées de la Russie, nous prenons des mesures supplémentaires. Nous imposons de nouvelles sanctions sévères aux responsables de ces attaques, nous suspendons le traitement de toute nouvelle demande de licence d’exportation vers la Russie et nous annulons les licences déjà accordées. De plus, nous délivrons de toute urgence des documents de voyage aux Canadiens et résidents permanents touchés et à leur famille immédiate. Nous accordons aussi la priorité aux demandes d’immigration des Ukrainiens qui souhaitent venir au Canada. En bref : le Canada ne restera pas les bras croisés alors que la Russie commet des actes d’agression et viole le droit international.

We cannot – and we will not – allow illegal and dangerous activities to continue. That’s why, earlier today, we announced that the federal government is invoking the Emergencies Act. The ongoing blockades and occupations are presenting serious challenges to law enforcement’s ability to effectively enforce the law, and the Act will strengthen and support law enforcement agencies across the country. The scope of these measures will be time-limited, geographically-targeted, and proportionate to the threats they are meant to address. To be clear: This is about keeping Canadians safe and protecting people’s jobs. That will continue to be what we’re focused on.
🇨🇦
Nous ne pouvons permettre la poursuite d'activités illégales et dangereuses, et nous ne le ferons pas. C’est pourquoi, plus tôt aujourd’hui, nous avons annoncé la décision du gouvernement fédéral d’invoquer la Loi sur les mesures d’urgence. Les barrages et les occupations qui ont lieu actuellement au pays nuisent gravement à la capacité des forces de l’ordre d’appliquer efficacement la loi. Le recours à la Loi sur les mesures d’urgence permettra de soutenir les organismes d’application de la loi dans tout le pays et de renforcer leurs capacités. Les mesures prévues seront limitées dans le temps, ciblées géographiquement et adaptées aux menaces auxquelles elles doivent répondre. Soyons clairs : notre objectif est de protéger les Canadiens et leurs emplois, et c’est sur cet objectif que nous continuerons d’axer nos efforts.

Canada, the United States, and countries across Europe are committed to supporting Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity. I spoke about that today with @POTUS and European leaders – we’ll keep pursuing de-escalation and a diplomatic solution.
🇨🇦
Le Canada, les É.-U. et des pays européens appuient fermement la souveraineté et l’intégrité territoriale de l’Ukraine. J’en ai parlé avec le @POTUS et des dirigeants européens – on va continuer à préconiser une désescalade et une solution diplomatique.

In the House of Commons earlier tonight, I spoke about the ongoing situation in Ottawa. I said that, while Canadians have the right to protest, to disagree with their government, and to make their voices heard, they don’t have the right to blockade our economy, or our democracy, or our fellow citizens’ daily lives. That has to stop. I was also very clear: The federal government will continue to be there with whatever resources are needed to get the situation under control. We’re here for the people of Ottawa, and our communities across the country. 
🇨🇦
Ce soir, à la Chambre des communes, j’ai parlé de la situation en cours à Ottawa. J’ai dit que, bien que les Canadiens aient le droit de manifester, d’être en désaccord avec leur gouvernement et de faire entendre leur voix, ils n’ont pas le droit de faire obstruction à notre économie, à notre démocratie ou à la vie quotidienne de leurs concitoyens. Il faut que ça cesse. J’ai aussi dit très clairement que le gouvernement fédéral reste prêt à fournir toute ressource qui sera nécessaire pour que la situation soit prise en main. On est là pour les gens d’Ottawa et pour nos communautés à travers le pays.

This morning’s press conference looked a little different, and that’s because I’m working remotely this week – I’ve tested positive for COVID-19. Two of my kids have tested positive, too. So when I say that I know this pandemic is frustrating, I mean it. I know it’s frustrating that, after two years of fighting this virus, we’re still not done. But over the past few days, Canadians have been shocked – and, frankly, disgusted – by the behaviour displayed by some people protesting in our nation’s capital. No matter how frustrated we are, we can’t let that kind of hatred and division be the answer. I spoke about all of that in my remarks this morning. If you weren’t able to tune in then, you can head on over to my Facebook to watch my full speech.
🇨🇦
La conférence de presse de ce matin avait un air un peu différent, et c’est parce que je travaille à distance cette semaine. J’ai obtenu un résultat positif au test de la COVID-19. Deux de mes enfants ont également reçu un résultat positif. C’est vrai que cette pandémie est frustrante. C’est frustrant qu’après deux ans de lutte contre ce virus, le combat ne soit toujours pas terminé. Mais au cours des derniers jours, les Canadiens ont été choqués – et, franchement, dégoûtés – par le comportement de certains manifestants dans notre capitale nationale. Peu importe notre niveau de frustration, nous ne pouvons pas laisser place à la haine et à la division. J’ai parlé de tout cela dans mon allocution de ce matin. Si vous n’avez pas pu l’écouter, vous pouvez vous rendre sur ma page Facebook pour la regarder dans son intégralité.

Let’s keep going.
 
When we return to Parliament next week, we’re going to be focused on keeping you safe and supported. We’re going to build on the progress we made last year, and we’re going to continue to deliver results for you and your family.
🇨🇦
Continuons.
 
Lorsque le Parlement reprendra ses travaux la semaine prochaine, nous veillerons à ce que vous soyez soutenus et en sécurité. Nous allons poursuivre les progrès réalisés l'année dernière et continuer d’obtenir des résultats pour vous et votre famille.

Good news for families in Nunavut! We’ve just signed an agreement with your territorial government to make child care more affordable. We’ll cut your fees in half by the end of the year, and we’ll get the cost down to $10 a day by March 2024 – two years ahead of other provinces and territories. So, even though I couldn’t be there in person today, know that we’re always going to be there for you and your family.
🇨🇦
Bonne nouvelle pour les familles du Nunavut! On vient de signer une entente avec votre gouvernement pour rendre les services de garde des jeunes enfants plus abordables. On va réduire de moitié vos frais d’ici la fin de l’année et vous offrir des services à 10 $ par jour d’ici mars 2024, soit deux ans avant les autres provinces et territoires. Alors, même si je ne peux être là en personne aujourd’hui, sachez qu’on va toujours être là pour vous et votre famille.

It can be a challenge to find a safe and affordable place to live, we know. To help with that, we’re creating more than 10,000 affordable housing units across the country through the Rapid Housing Initiative. These units will help vulnerable Canadians and those experiencing, or at risk of, homelessness. A third of the units will support women or women and their kids, and more than a third will be there for Indigenous peoples. And like I said last June, when I visited this Rapid Housing Initiative site under construction in Kanata, we’ll keep working to make sure everyone has a roof over their head.
🇨🇦
Il peut être difficile de trouver un chez-soi sûr et abordable, on le sait. Pour vous faciliter la vie, on crée plus de 10 000 logements abordables au pays au moyen de l’Initiative pour la création rapide de logements. Ces logements aideront les Canadiens vulnérables et ceux qui sont ou risquent d’être en situation d’itinérance. Le tiers des logements aideront des femmes ou des femmes et leurs enfants et plus du tiers aideront les peuples autochtones. Et comme je l’ai dit en juin dernier quand j’ai visité ce chantier de l’Initiative pour la création rapide de logements à Kanata, on va continuer nos efforts pour que tout le monde ait un toit sur la tête.

After hearing about the recent break-ins at Brown Loaf Bakery, @yasirnaqvicdn and I decided to stop by and meet Yan – and pick up some treats, of course. Evidently, we weren’t the only one who wanted to show our support – they were sold out of almost everything. #SupportLocal
🇨🇦
Quand on a entendu parler des récents vols à la boulangerie Brown Loaf, @yasirnaqvicdn et moi avons décidé d’aller voir Yan et d’acheter quelques gâteries, bien sûr. On a vu qu’on n’était pas les seuls à lui montrer notre soutien – ils manquaient de presque tout. #AppuiLocal

Throughout this pandemic, health care workers – like the ones I’ve met at hospitals and clinics across the country – have been working flat out to keep us all safe. They deserve nothing less than our full support and our sincere thanks. Yet too often, we’ve seen footage and heard stories of people intimidating and threatening them. That’s unacceptable. And that’s why our government introduced legislation to criminalize this abhorrent behaviour. That legislation has now come into force and, as of yesterday, it is illegal to intimidate doctors, nurses, and patients – or to obstruct them from providing care or seeking treatment. We’ll continue to have the backs of health care workers.
🇨🇦
Tout au long de la pandémie, les travailleurs de la santé – comme ceux que j’ai rencontrés dans des hôpitaux et des cliniques d’un bout à l’autre du pays – ont tout donné pour nous protéger. Ils ne méritent rien de moins que notre plein soutien et nos sincères remerciements. Pourtant, on a trop souvent vu des vidéos et entendu des histoires de gens qui les intimidaient ou les menaçaient. C’est inacceptable. Et c’est pourquoi notre gouvernement a adopté une loi pour criminaliser ces comportements aberrants. Cette loi est maintenant entrée en vigueur et, depuis hier, il est illégal d’intimider des médecins, des infirmières ou des patients ou de les empêcher de fournir ou de recevoir des soins. On va rester là pour les travailleurs de la santé.

Here’s a flashback - and an update - for you this Friday. Six months ago, we announced an agreement with Nova Scotia that would make child care more affordable for families across the province by cutting the cost in half before the end of 2022, and by getting the cost down to $10 a day by the end of 2026. Today, we joined the province again to share some good news with parents. Here’s what we told them: If you have kids under 6, your child care fees are going down 25% on average. This decrease begins as of April 1st, and is retroactive to January 1st. For the average parent, this means you’ll pay $200 less each month. This is an important step forward as we continue to work on delivering a Canada-wide early learning and child care system, and we’ll keep working to make sure families right across the country have access to affordable child care. #FBF
🇨🇦
Voici un retour en arrière - et une mise à jour - pour vous en ce vendredi. Il y a six mois, nous avons annoncé la conclusion d’un accord avec la Nouvelle-Écosse pour rendre les services de garde d’enfants plus abordables pour les familles de la province en réduisant de moitié les frais de garde avant la fin de 2022 et en ramenant les frais à 10 $ par jour d’ici la fin de 2026. Et, aujourd’hui, nous nous sommes joints une fois de plus à la province pour annoncer une autre bonne nouvelle aux parents. Voici ce que nous leur avons dit: si vos enfants ont moins de 6 ans, vos frais de garde seront réduits de 25 % en moyenne. Cette baisse entrera en vigueur le 1er avril et sera rétroactive au 1er janvier. Le parent moyen aura donc à débourser 200 $ de moins par mois. C’est un grand pas en avant, tandis que nous nous efforçons de bâtir un réseau pancanadien d’apprentissage et de garde des jeunes enfants. Et nous continuerons de tout faire pour que les familles d’un bout à l’autre du pays aient accès à des services de garde abordables. #VendrediNostalgie

As of today, it’s official: Conversion therapy is banned in Canada. Our government’s legislation has come into force - which means it is now illegal to promote, advertise, benefit from, or subject someone to this hateful and harmful practice. LGBTQ2 rights are human rights.

La loi de notre gouvernement interdisant la thérapie de conversion au Canada est entrée en vigueur. Il est maintenant illégal de promouvoir ou publiciser cette pratique haineuse et néfaste, d’en profiter ou d’y soumettre quelqu’un. Les droits des LGBTQ2 sont des droits humains.

This photo was taken just over a year ago, when the first doses of Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine touched down in Canada. In the months since then, thanks to so many of you who’ve stepped up and done your part, we’ve made a lot of progress. More than 86% of eligible Canadians have had at least one shot, and over 80% are fully vaccinated. And our vaccination rates are among the highest in the world. But we’ve got to keep going. If you haven’t been vaccinated yet, please, get your shots. #TBT
🇨🇦
Cette photo a été prise il y a un peu plus d’un an, au moment où les premières doses du vaccin contre la COVID-19 de Pfizer sont arrivées au Canada. Dans les mois qui ont suivi, grâce aux gens qui ont répondu à l’appel en si grand nombre pour faire leur part, nous avons fait beaucoup de progrès. Plus de 86 % des Canadiens admissibles ont reçu au moins une dose, et plus de 80 % sont pleinement vaccinés. Et nos taux de vaccination sont parmi les plus élevés du monde. Mais nous devons continuer. Si vous n’avez pas encore été vacciné, s’il vous plaît, allez-y. #JeudiRétro

You’ve probably seen the front of this room on TV before, but here’s a look at the whole thing. We were back here today to remind you and people across the country that, as we continue to fight COVID-19 and deal with the impacts of the Omicron variant, there are benefits and programs available to help you. Whether you’re a small business owner looking to keep your workers on the job, or a parent who can’t go to work because your kids are home from school, or a worker who needs to isolate because of COVID-19, there’s support available for you - so please, use it. For more information and to apply for these programs and benefits, click the link in my bio.
🇨🇦
Vous avez probablement déjà vu l’avant de cette pièce à la télévision, mais voici un coup d’œil d’ensemble. On est revenu ici aujourd’hui pour vous rappeler, à vous et aux gens de partout au pays, que pendant qu’on continue de lutter contre la COVID-19 et de gérer les conséquences du variant Omicron, des prestations et des programmes sont là pour vous aider. Que vous soyez un propriétaire de petite entreprise qui cherche à garder ses employés, un parent qui doit s’absenter du travail parce que ses enfants ne sont pas à l’école, ou un travailleur qui doit s’isoler à cause de la COVID-19, il y a une mesure d’aide pour vous - alors, s’il vous plaît, utilisez-la. Pour plus d’information et pour faire une demande pour ces programmes et prestations, cliquez sur le lien dans ma bio.

Got my booster shot this morning. To everyone out there who’s gotten their shots, and to the health care workers who are getting these shots into arms, thank you for doing your part. And to anyone who’s eligible but hasn’t yet been vaccinated or boosted, please, do that now.
🇨🇦
J’ai reçu ma dose de rappel ce matin. À tous ceux qui se sont fait vacciner et à tous les travailleurs de la santé, merci de faire votre part. Aux gens admissibles qui n’ont encore eu ni vaccin ni dose de rappel, s’il vous plaît, allez-y maintenant.

It’s not quite midnight yet, I know, but we’re all ready to say this sooner than later anyway: happy New Year! As we reflect on the past year, before it wraps up for good, I wanted to share with you some of the moments that have stuck with me the most - you can swipe through to see them. And as we look to the year ahead with hope, know that Sophie and I are wishing you and your loved ones the very best. #FBF
🇨🇦
Il n’est pas encore tout à fait minuit, je sais, mais nous sommes tous prêts à le dire: bonne année! Tandis que nous réfléchissons à l’année qui vient de s’écouler, et avant que celle-ci ne s’achève pour de bon, j’ai voulu partager avec vous certains des moments qui m’ont le plus marqué. Faites glisser votre curseur pour les voir. Et alors que nous envisageons l’année à venir avec espoir, Sophie et moi vous offrons, à vous et à vos proches, nos meilleurs vœux. #VendrediNostalgie

Merry Christmas! As we celebrate the holidays and head into the new year, let’s remember that brighter days are ahead - and we’ll reach them together. From our family to yours, Hadrien, Ella-Grace, Xavier, Sophie and I wish you joy, health and love. 
🇨🇦
Joyeux Noël! À l’aube de la nouvelle année, rappelons-nous que des jours meilleurs nous attendent et que nous pourrons tous en profiter ensemble. De notre famille à la vôtre, Hadrien, Ella-Grace, Xavier, Sophie et moi vous souhaitons joie, santé et amour.

Both of these photos are from four years ago, when the world looked a little different than it does today. But something that was true then and remains true today is that all of our kids deserve the best possible start in life. That’s why, at these visits - which were in Moncton, New Brunswick and Yellowknife, Northwest Territories - we were focused on supporting early learning and child care. And that’s why, this past week, we announced agreements with both New Brunswick and the Northwest Territories to continue investing in our kids. We’re going to work with the province and the territory to cut the cost of child care in half by this time next year, and we’ll get that cost down to $10 a day within five years. We’ve signed agreements with 11 provinces and territories now, and we’ll keep working to make sure families across the country have access to affordable child care.
🇨🇦
Ces deux photos ont été prises il y a quatre ans, lorsque le monde semblait un peu différent de ce qu’il est aujourd’hui. Mais ce qui était vrai à l’époque et qui demeure vrai aujourd’hui, c’est que nos enfants méritent le meilleur départ possible dans la vie. C’est pourquoi, dans le cadre de nos visites à Moncton, au Nouveau-Brunswick et à Yellowknife, dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest, on s’est concentrés sur l’aide aux services d’apprentissage et de garde des jeunes enfants. Et c’est pourquoi, la semaine passée, on a annoncé des ententes avec le Nouveau-Brunswick et les Territoires du Nord-Ouest afin de continuer d’investir dans nos enfants. On va travailler avec la province et le territoire afin de réduire les frais de garde de moitié d’ici l’an prochain à pareille date, et on va réduire ce coût à 10 $ par jour en cinq ans. On a maintenant signé des ententes avec 11 provinces et territoires, et on va continuer à travailler pour que toutes les familles du pays aient accès à des services de garde abordables.

Good news for parents across the Northwest Territories: We’re working closely with the territory to create more child care spaces for your kids, cut fees in half by the end of next year, and get that cost down to an average of $10 a day within five years. For families in Yellowknife, as an example, that would mean average savings of $9,500 each year. That’s big. And we’re going to keep working to bring this good news to parents and kids right across the country, to create new jobs for early childhood educators, and to grow the middle class - this is our 11th agreement with the provinces and territories, and we’re not done yet.
🇨🇦
Bonne nouvelle pour les parents des Territoires du Nord-Ouest : nous collaborons de près avec le territoire afin de créer davantage de places en garderie pour vos enfants, de réduire de moitié les frais de garde d’ici la fin de l’année prochaine et de ramener ces frais à une moyenne de 10 $ par jour d’ici cinq ans. Cela permettra aux familles de Yellowknife, par exemple, d’économiser en moyenne 9 500 $ par année. C’est énorme. Et nous allons poursuivre nos efforts pour que les parents et les enfants de tout le pays puissent recevoir cette bonne nouvelle ainsi que pour créer des emplois pour les éducateurs de la petite enfance et faire croître la classe moyenne. Il s’agit de notre 11e entente avec les provinces et les territoires, et nous n’avons pas fini.

Hopped on the phone with Chrystia Freeland this afternoon - just after she shared the Economic and Fiscal Update. She delivered her remarks virtually, instead of in-person in the House of Commons, after two members of her team tested positive for COVID-19. This change of plans is yet another reminder of how serious this virus and the Omicron variant are - and how important it is that we all continue to follow public health measures. That’s why we’re staying focused on beating COVID-19 - and why, as Chrystia confirmed in her speech today, we’re offering free boosters to Canadians and delivering more rapid tests to the provinces and territories. Also confirmed in today’s economic update: We’re going to keep being there for you and your family. We’ll tackle the rising cost of living, put home ownership back in reach, get the job done on $10-a-day child care, be bolder in the fight against climate change, move further down the path of reconciliation, and continue to create good jobs for the middle class. That’s how we can come back stronger than ever.
🇨🇦
Cet après-midi, j’ai parlé avec Chrystia Freeland juste après sa Mise à jour économique et budgétaire. Elle a dû faire son allocution virtuellement devant la Chambre des communes, car deux membres de son équipe ont la COVID-19. Ce changement de plans nous rappelle la gravité de la situation entourant ce virus et le variant Omicron et l’importance de suivre les mesures sanitaires. C’est pourquoi notre priorité reste de vaincre la COVID-19. Et pourquoi, comme l’a dit Chrystia aujourd’hui, nous offrons une dose de rappel gratuite aux Canadiens et d’autres tests rapides aux provinces et territoires. Nous avons aussi confirmé aujourd’hui que nous resterons là pour vous et votre famille. Nous combattrons la hausse du coût de la vie, nous redonnerons l’accès à la propriété, nous créerons des places abordables en garderie, nous agirons plus énergiquement pour le climat, nous avancerons sur la voie de la réconciliation et nous continuerons de créer de bons emplois pour la classe moyenne. Et nous ressortirons de cette crise plus forts que jamais.

Hey, New Brunswickers! If you’re a parent who has kids under the age of 6, this message is for you. Today, our government and the provincial government announced an agreement to make $10-a-day child care a reality for families across the province within the next five years. This is our tenth agreement with the provinces and territories. In it, we’ve committed to creating thousands of new spaces for your kids, and we’ll grow a strong and skilled workforce of early childhood educators, too. At the end of the day, this agreement will make your life more affordable, give your kids the best start in life, and help grow the middle class - and that’s good news for you, your family, and our economy.
🇨🇦
Hé, les parents du Nouveau-Brunswick! Si vous avez des enfants de moins de six ans, ce message s’adresse à vous. Aujourd’hui, notre gouvernement et le gouvernement provincial ont annoncé la signature d’une entente pour offrir des services de garde d’enfants à 10 $ par jour aux familles de la province d’ici les cinq prochaines années. Il s’agit de la dixième entente que nous concluons avec les provinces et territoires. Nous y énonçons notre engagement à créer des milliers de places en garderie pour vos enfants et une main-d’œuvre solide et qualifiée d’éducatrices de la petite enfance. Au bout du compte, cette entente rendra votre vie plus abordable, offrira à vos enfants le meilleur départ possible dans la vie et aidera à faire croître la classe moyenne. Voilà une bonne nouvelle pour vous, votre famille et notre économie.

Women must be at all decision-making tables, not just when it comes to so-called “women’s issues.” From addressing affordability, to creating jobs, to building a resilient recovery, we need your voices across the spectrum of economic work. That’s why, today, I sat down with the Women’s Economic Council of Canada for their inaugural meeting. We spoke about our $10-a-day child care agreements with provinces and territories, the work we’re doing to build on our Women Entrepreneurship Strategy, and our continued focus on growing our economy - let’s keep working together.
🇨🇦
Les femmes doivent participer à tous les processus décisionnels, et pas seulement lorsqu’il s’agit de questions dites « féminines ». Qu’on parle du coût de la vie, de création d’emplois ou de la mise en place d’une relance résiliente, nous avons besoin de connaître vos opinions dans tous les domaines de l’activité économique. C’est pourquoi j’ai rencontré aujourd’hui le Conseil économique des femmes du Canada durant sa réunion inaugurale. Nous avons parlé de nos ententes avec les provinces et les territoires sur les services de garde d’enfants à 10 $ par jour, du travail que nous faisons pour tirer parti de notre Stratégie pour les femmes en entrepreneuriat et des efforts soutenus que nous déployons pour faire croître notre économie. Continuons à travailler ensemble.

It’s here, at vaccine clinics, that we’ll finish the fight against COVID-19. To all of the kids and parents who were at the clinic I visited in Scarborough this morning, thank you for doing your part. And to anyone who hasn’t gotten their shots yet, now’s the time to get them.
🇨🇦
C’est ici, en clinique de vaccination, qu’on en finira avec la COVID-19. J’aimerais dire aux enfants et aux parents présents à la clinique de Scarborough que j’ai visitée ce matin : merci de faire votre part. Et à ceux qui ne sont pas encore vaccinés : c’est le temps de le faire.

In Canada, in Somalia, and around the world, @ElmanPeace’s @IlwadElman is known for her social activism - and for her work addressing gender-based violence and promoting human rights. We spoke about that today, and about what more we can do to keep making progress.
🇨🇦
Au Canada, en Somalie et dans le monde entier, @IlwadElman du @ElmanPeace est connue pour son activisme social et son travail lié à la violence fondée sur le sexe et à la promotion des droits de la personne. On a parlé de cela aujourd’hui et de la façon de continuer à avancer.

We’ve come a long way since the first woman was elected to the House - now, over 100 women sit in Parliament. But we need more. So to everyone at @EqualVoiceCA’s event yesterday, my message is this: let’s keep pushing for gender equality in politics and all sectors of society.
🇨🇦
On a fait bien des progrès depuis l’élection de la 1re femme à la Chambre. Aujourd’hui, plus de 100 femmes siègent au Parlement. Mais il en faut plus. Mon message aux participants à l’activité d’@EqualVoiceCA d’hier : continuons d’exiger l’égalité en politique et dans la société.

We remember their names. We honour their memory. Tonight in Montreal, we stood together against this hateful, senseless, misogynistic violence. Tomorrow, and every single day after, we’ll keep working to make sure that this type of tragedy never happens again. #December6
🇨🇦
Nous nous souvenons de leurs noms. Nous honorons leur mémoire. Ce soir, à Montréal, nous nous sommes unis contre cette violence haineuse, insensée et misogyne. Demain, et chaque jour qui suivra, nous veillerons à ce qu’une telle tragédie ne se reproduise plus jamais. #6décembre

They were strong. They were smart. They were women. And they were murdered because of it. We cannot allow this gender-based violence to exist. So today, as we honour the memory of these 14 women, let us all keep working to end this violence - for good.
🇨🇦
Elles étaient fortes et intelligentes. Des femmes assassinées en raison de leur sexe. La violence fondée sur le sexe doit disparaître. Rendons hommage à ces 14 femmes et mettons tout en œuvre pour mettre fin à cette violence pour de bon.

The best thing we can do for ourselves, our kids, and all of our loved ones is to get vaccinated. Sophie and I already got our shots - and today, Hadrien got his first one. If you or your kids haven’t gotten yours yet, please, get them as soon as you can.
🇨🇦
Le meilleur moyen de nous protéger et de protéger nos enfants et tous ceux qu'on aime est de se faire vacciner. Sophie et moi l’avons déjà fait et, aujourd’hui, Hadrien a reçu sa première dose. Si vous ou vos enfants n’êtes pas encore vaccinés, faites-le dès que possible.

Nav Bhatia fought against systemic racism and discrimination, and eventually became a successful businessman - and a true @Raptors superfan! @NavBhatiaSuperfan: you are an inspiration. I’m glad we could celebrate your journey, and your uniquely Canadian story, tonight.
🇨🇦
Nav Bhatia a lutté contre le racisme et la discrimination systémiques, et est finalement devenu un homme d’ffaires prospère… et un superfan des @Raptors! Vous êtes une source d’inspiration, @NavBhatiaSuperfan. Ravi de pouvoir célébrer votre parcours typiquement canadien ce soir.

Canada’s Jewish communities remind us that light will always triumph and kindness will always win out. To them, and to all of the friends and colleagues who took part in tonight’s virtual candle-lighting ceremony in celebration of Hanukkah: Chag Hanukkah Sameach.
🇨🇦
Les communautés juives du Canada nous rappellent que la lumière et la gentillesse l’emporteront toujours. À ces communautés ainsi qu’aux amis et collègues qui ont participé ce soir à la cérémonie virtuelle d’allumage de bougies pour célébrer Hanoukka : Chag Hanukkah Sameach.

I spent some time with volunteers from A Ripple Effect today - they spoke about the work they’re doing and how people are pulling together to look after one another. It’s the epitome of Tikkun Olam. Thank you for stepping up to serve your community, and thank you for the Menorah!
🇨🇦
J’ai passé du temps avec des bénévoles de Ripple Effect aujourd’hui. Ils m’ont parlé du travail qu’ils font et des gens qui unissent leurs forces pour s’entraider. C’est l’exemple même du Tikkoun Olam. Merci d’avoir accepté de servir votre communauté, et merci pour la menorah!

To all of the emergency responders, elected officials, Indigenous leaders, community volunteers, and @CanadianForces members in Abbotsford: thank you for stepping up and pitching in after the recent floods. The hard work you're doing is so appreciated. I'm glad I could spend some time with you today and hear about your experiences. We’ll continue to be here for you and we will rebuild, together.
🇨🇦
À tous les intervenants d’urgence, représentants élus, dirigeants autochtones, bénévoles de la communauté et membres des @ForcesCanada à Abbotsford : merci d’être intervenus après les récentes inondations. Vos efforts acharnés sont grandement appréciés. Je suis heureux d’avoir pu passer un peu de temps avec vous aujourd’hui pour en savoir plus au sujet de vos expériences. Nous continuerons d’être là pour vous, et nous allons rebâtir ensemble.

This decade got off to an incredibly difficult start - there’s no question about that. But we can make it better as we rebuild. Because this is the moment to get big things done. This is the moment to shape a better future for our kids. And we’ve got the plan to meet this moment. We outlined that plan in the Speech from the Throne today, and shared what we’ll do to address the challenges our country is facing. We’re going to finish the fight against COVID-19 and strengthen health care, tackle the rising cost of living and make your life more affordable while growing the middle class, take bolder climate action than ever before, and work harder to make your community safer. We’re also going to keep standing up for diversity and inclusion, move faster on the path of reconciliation, and continue to strengthen our partnerships with countries around the world. For more details on how we’ll make progress on these priorities and meet this moment, click the link in my bio.
🇨🇦
Cette décennie a connu des débuts incroyablement difficiles, ça ne fait aucun doute. Cependant, nous pouvons la rendre meilleure en rebâtissant. Parce que c’est le moment de faire de grandes choses. C’est le moment de façonner un avenir meilleur pour nos enfants. Et nous avons un plan à la hauteur de la situation. Nous avons présenté ce plan lors du discours du Trône, aujourd’hui, et nous avons expliqué ce que nous ferons pour relever les défis de notre pays. Nous allons en finir avec la COVID-19 et renforcer les soins de santé, nous attaquer à la hausse du coût de la vie et rendre votre vie plus abordable tout en faisant croître la classe moyenne, agir plus que jamais pour le climat et travailler encore plus fort afin de rendre vos communautés plus sûres. Nous allons aussi continuer de prôner la diversité et l’inclusion, accélérer nos progrès sur la voie de la réconciliation et resserrer nos partenariats avec des pays du monde entier. Pour en savoir plus sur les moyens que nous prendrons pour faire avancer ces priorités et être à la hauteur de la situation, cliquez sur le lien dans ma bio.

Mister Speaker, congratulations on your re-election! This is a historic moment of change and opportunity for our country, and I know you’ll continue to serve Parliamentarians well as you guide us - and the work we do in the House - forward.
🇨🇦
Félicitations pour votre réélection, Monsieur le Président! En cette période historique de changement et de possibilités, je sais que vous continuerez de bien guider les parlementaires pour faire avancer le travail que nous faisons à la Chambre.

Less than a month ago, @ChrystiaFreeland and I visited the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario to announce that we’d have enough doses of Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine for kids between the ages of 5 and 11, if and when Health Canada approved it. Well, the vaccine was approved today - and we’ll have 2.9 million doses in the country next week. That means, in a matter of days, we’ll have enough doses for every eligible child to get their first shot. And as the father of a 7-year-old, let me tell you, I know what a relief this news is.
🇨🇦
Il y a moins d’un mois, @ChrystiaFreeland sommes allés au Centre hospitalier pour enfants de l’est de l’Ontario pour annoncer qu’on aurait assez de doses du vaccin de Pfizer contre la COVID-19 pour vacciner les enfants de 5 à 11 ans si Santé Canada approuvait son usage chez les enfants. Eh bien, Santé Canada a donné son approbation aujourd’hui, et on recevra 2,9 millions de doses au pays la semaine prochaine. Dans quelques jours, on aura donc assez de doses pour que chaque enfant admissible obtienne son premier vaccin. Étant moi-même papa d’un enfant de 7 ans, je sais que cette nouvelle est un véritable soulagement.

That’s a wrap - the North American Leaders’ Summit has come to an end. Throughout it, and in my one-on-one meetings with @POTUS Biden and President @LopezObrador earlier in the day, my focus was on strengthening Canda’s partnerships with the United States and Mexico. Whether it’s finishing the fight against COVID-19, getting the job done on vaccines, strengthening our supply chains, taking bolder climate action, creating good jobs for the middle class, or supporting an economic recovery that benefits everyone, we’ll keep working together to make progress on our shared priorities. Because that’s how we’ll create new opportunities for our countries and make sure North America remains the most competitive region in the world.
🇨🇦
Le Sommet des leaders nord-américains est maintenant terminé. Tout au long du Sommet, et lors de mes rencontres individuelles avec le @POTUS Biden et le président @LopezObrador plus tôt aujourd’hui, j’ai mis l’accent sur le renforcement des partenariats du Canada avec les États-Unis et le Mexique. Qu’il s’agisse de terminer la lutte contre la COVID-19, de mener à bien la campagne de vaccination, de renforcer nos chaînes d'approvisionnement, de prendre des mesures plus audacieuses en matière de climat, de créer de bons emplois pour la classe moyenne ou d’assurer une relance économique qui profite à tous, nous continuerons de travailler ensemble pour faire progresser nos priorités communes. Car c’est ainsi que nous pourrons créer des possibilités pour nos pays et faire en sorte que l’Amérique du Nord demeure la région la plus compétitive au monde.

Canada and the United States have a long history of standing side-by-side and working together. I spoke about that in my meetings yesterday with Nancy Pelosi, the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives, and Kevin McCarthy, the House of Representatives Minority Leader, as well as Chuck Schumer, the United States Senate Majority Leader, and Mitch McConnell, the Senate Minority Leader. We also spoke about how we can strengthen the enduring partnership between our countries - and that will continue to be my focus at today’s North American Leaders’ Summit with President Biden and President Lopez Obrador. Together, we’ll keep working for the benefit of people in Canada, the United States, and Mexico.
🇨🇦
Le Canada et les États-Unis perpétuent une longue tradition de solidarité et de collaboration. Je l’ai souligné hier durant mes réunions avec Nancy Pelosi, présidente de la Chambre de représentants des États-Unis, Kevin McCarthy, leader de la minorité à la Chambre des représentants, Chuck Schumer, leader de la majorité au Sénat des États-Unis, et Mitch McConnell, leader de la minorité au Sénat. On a également parlé des moyens de resserrer le partenariat durable entre nos deux pays - et cette question restera au centre de mes discussions aujourd’hui, durant le Sommet des dirigeants nord-américains, avec le président Biden et le président Lopez Obrador. Ensemble, on va continuer de travailler au profit des populations du Canada, des États-Unis et du Mexique.

We’re off to Washington for the North American Leaders’ Summit. While there, we’ll sit down with our American neighbours and Mexican partners to make progress on our shared priorities, find solutions to global challenges, and more. I’ll keep you posted here - stay tuned.
🇨🇦
Nous partons à Washington pour le Sommet des leaders nord-américains, où nous collaborerons avec nos partenaires américains et mexicains pour faire progresser nos priorités communes, trouver des solutions aux défis mondiaux et plus encore. Suivez ce fil pour des mises à jours.

Let me tell you - after the win on Friday and ahead of tomorrow’s game, there was a whole lot of energy on the field when I met the Canada men’s national soccer team today. @CanadaSoccer: You’ve got this.
🇨🇦
Laissez-moi vous dire qu’après la victoire de vendredi et avant le match de demain, il y avait beaucoup d’énergie sur le terrain lorsque j’ai rencontré l’équipe nationale de soccer masculine aujourd’hui. Allez, @CanadaSoccer, vous êtes capables!

We’re going to finish the fight against COVID-19 - and we’re going to do it thanks to people working at vaccine clinics, like the one we visited in Edmonton today, and thanks to every Canadian who has stepped up to get vaccinated. If you haven’t done so already, get your shots.
🇨🇦
On va en finir avec la COVID-19 - grâce aux personnes qui travaillent dans les centres de vaccination, comme celui que j’ai visité à Edmonton aujourd’hui, et grâce à tous les Canadiens qui ont pris l’initiative de se faire vacciner. Si ce n’est déjà fait, faites-vous vacciner.

$10. That’s how much child care is going to cost, on average per day, for families in Alberta. Deputy Prime Minister Freeland, Minister Gould, Minister Boissonnault, and I were in Edmonton this morning to share the news that we’ve just signed an agreement with the province to make that a reality. And while we were there, we also shared that we’re going to create more spaces and improve access, so parents can get the affordable and inclusive child care they need - and their kids can get the best possible start in life.
🇨🇦
10 $. Voilà ce que coûteront par jour, en moyenne, les services de garde d’enfants pour les familles de l’Alberta. La vice-première ministre Freeland, la ministre Gould, le ministre Boissonnault et moi étaient à Edmonton ce matin afin d’annoncer que nous venons de signer une entente avec la province pour faire de ce projet une réalité. Pendant notre visite, nous avons également annoncé que nous allions créer davantage de places et améliorer l’accès à ces services, afin que les parents puissent obtenir les services de garde abordables et inclusifs dont ils ont besoin et que leurs enfants puissent avoir le meilleur départ possible dans la vie.

They served and sacrificed to secure a better future for Canada and the world. We must never forget that. Remember them - today and every day. #CanadaRemembers
🇨🇦
Ils ont servi et ont fait des sacrifices afin d’assurer un avenir meilleur au Canada et au monde. Nous ne devons jamais l’oublier. Souvenez-vous d’eux aujourd’hui et chaque jour. #LeCanadaSeSouvient

If it weren’t for the people of Papineau, I wouldn’t be here. I’m thankful for every single one of them, and for every single moment I get to represent them in Parliament - and I’m really looking forward to seeing all that we can accomplish together in the years to come.
🇨🇦
Si ce n’était des gens de Papineau, je ne serais pas ici. Je remercie chacun d’entre eux et je suis reconnaissant d’avoir le privilège de les représenter au Parlement. J’ai bien hâte de voir tout ce que nous pourrons accomplir ensemble dans les années à venir.

When it comes to conversations about peace and security, we’ve been working to make sure more women are at the table - like the 2021 class of the Halifax Peace With Women Fellowship, who we sat down with today. Thanks for sharing your time and thoughts with us.
🇨🇦
Quand il s’agit de paix et de sécurité, on va veiller à ce que plus de femmes soient à la table, comme celles de la cohorte 2021 de la Halifax Peace With Women Fellowship avec qui on a discuté aujourd’hui. Merci pour votre temps et vos idées.

John, Sharp, Tim, and Julia are Indigenous veterans. They, like thousands of other Indigenous veterans whose service has not always been celebrated and whose stories have not often been told, served with courage and determination - and I was honoured to spend time with them this morning. To them, and to all Indigenous veterans who sacrificed so much for, and contributed so much to, our country over the years: thank you. We’ll forever be grateful to you and your families.
🇨🇦
John, Sharp, Tim et Julia sont des vétérans autochtones. Comme des milliers d’autres vétérans autochtones dont l’engagement n’a pas toujours été célébré et les histoires n’ont pas souvent été racontées, ils ont servi notre pays avec courage et détermination. Ce fut un privilège de passer du temps avec eux, ce matin. Je leur dis, ainsi qu’à tous les vétérans autochtones qui ont tant sacrifié - et tant donné - pour notre pays au fil des ans : merci. Vous et vos familles avez toute notre gratitude.

Our caucus met earlier today, and I can’t tell you how good it was to see old friends and welcome new faces. From making life more affordable for families and the middle class, to tackling the climate crisis with ambition and urgency, to walking the path of reconciliation, to finishing the fight against COVID-19, we’re committed to making progress on the things that matter most to you.
🇨🇦
Notre caucus s’est réuni plus tôt aujourd’hui, et je ne pourrais vous dire à quel point ça a été agréable de voir de vieux amis et d’accueillir de nouveaux visages. Qu’il s’agisse de rendre la vie plus abordable pour les familles et les gens de la classe moyenne, de s’attaquer à la crise climatique avec ambition et urgence, d’avancer sur le chemin de la réconciliation ou de finir la lutte contre la COVID-19, on est déterminés à faire des progrès dans les dossiers les plus importants pour vous.

Today’s a good day to get your flu shot - I got mine this morning. It’s an easy way to protect yourself and those around you. So, if you still need to get yours, check canada.ca/flu for information on where to go. #ForJudeForEveryone
🇨🇦
C’est une bonne journée pour vous faire vacciner contre la grippe - je l’ai fait ce matin. Faites-le pour vous protéger vous-même et les gens que vous aimez. Si vous ne l’avez pas fait, consultez canada.ca/grippe pour savoir où aller.

In Brampton this afternoon, we gathered together with Jasmine from @IndiasTasteCanada to celebrate Diwali and help make boxes of sweets for families observing this joyous festival. To them, and to everyone celebrating over the next few days, happy Diwali!
🇨🇦
À Brampton, cet après-midi, nous nous sommes réunis avec Jasmine d’@IndiasTasteCanada pour célébrer Diwali et aider à fabriquer des boîtes de friandises pour les familles qui observent cet heureux festival. Joyeux Diwali à tous ceux qui le célébreront au cours des prochains jours!

Bill Davis loved politics. He knew it was where he could get things done, and where he could help people. That’s what he was all about. And as the second-longest-serving Premier of Ontario, that’s what he did. Whether it’s in public education, health care, or transit, he made investments in physical and social infrastructure that helped build communities where people felt secure in the knowledge that they had opportunities to succeed. Through it all, he led with humility and humour, kindness and calmness - and he inspired so many people across the province. Today in Toronto, we came together to celebrate the life of this remarkable leader. Bill, your family and friends miss you dearly, and so does a grateful country.
🇨🇦
Bill Davis aimait la politique. Parce qu’il savait que c’était là qu'il pouvait faire avancer les choses et aider les gens. C’est tout ce qui lui importait. Et, figurant au deuxième rang en matière de longévité au poste de premier ministre de l’Ontario, c’est ce qu’il a fait. Qu’il s’agisse d’éducation publique, de soins de santé ou de transport en commun, il a fait des investissements dans les infrastructures physiques et sociales qui ont contribué à l’établissement de communautés où les gens étaient convaincus d’avoir la possibilité de réussir. À travers tout cela, il a dirigé avec humilité, humour, bonté et calme, et il a inspiré de très nombreuses personnes dans la province. Aujourd’hui, à Toronto, nous nous sommes réunis pour célébrer la vie de ce dirigeant remarquable. Bill, tu manques énormément à ta famille et à tes amis, ainsi qu’à un pays reconnaissant.

When we visited the Bergen-op-Zoom Canadian War Cemetery in the Netherlands, on my mind was Lt. Jean Robert Grégoire - Sophie’s great-uncle - who served during the Second World War and made the ultimate sacrifice in Normandy. This year, my digital poppy is dedicated to him. You can honour our veterans, who served and sacrificed for our country and our freedom, too. To do that, head on over to MyPoppy.ca and customize your digital poppy, or look out for the poppy boxes around your community.
🇨🇦
Au Cimetière de guerre canadien de Bergen-op-Zoom aux Pays-Bas, j’ai pensé au lieutenant Jean Robert Grégoire, le grand-oncle de Sophie, qui a servi lors de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale et fait l’ultime sacrifice en Normandie. Cette année, je lui dédie mon coquelicot numérique. Vous aussi pouvez honorer nos vétérans qui se sont dévoués pour notre pays et notre liberté. Personnalisez votre coquelicot numérique sur MonCoquelicot.ca ou trouvez une boîte à coquelicots près de chez vous.

Over the past two days, leaders from around the world gathered in Glasgow to address climate change. It’s the greatest threat of our time, but it’s also the greatest opportunity for our economy and workers. In my meetings, during our working sessions, and throughout my speeches, I’ve driven those points home. I’ve also advocated for increased climate action, called on leaders to be bolder than ever before, and outlined how Canada is stepping up - I announced new commitments that will cut pollution and create opportunities, and I shared what more we’re doing to protect nature and address biodiversity loss. There’s always more to do, though, and that’s why we’ll keep working with partners - at #COP26 and beyond - to tackle this global crisis. We can, we must, and we will succeed.
🇨🇦
Au cours des deux derniers jours, des dirigeants du monde entier se sont réunis à Glasgow pour aborder la question des changements climatiques. Ils sont la plus grande menace de notre époque, mais ils représentent également la plus grande opportunité pour notre économie et nos travailleurs. J’ai insisté sur ces points lors de mes réunions et de nos séances de travail ainsi que dans mes allocutions. J’ai également plaidé en faveur d’une action climatique accrue, demandé aux dirigeants d’être plus audacieux que jamais et décrit les mesures que prend le Canada à cet égard. J’ai annoncé de nouveaux engagements visant à réduire la pollution et à créer des possibilités, et j’ai fait part des mesures supplémentaires que nous prenons pour protéger la nature et lutter contre la perte de biodiversité. Cependant, il y a toujours plus à faire. C’est pourquoi nous poursuivrons notre collaboration avec nos partenaires - à la #COP26 et au‑delà - pour lutter contre cette crise mondiale. Nous pouvons et devons le faire, et nous allons réussir.

Climate action can’t wait. We need to do more, we need to be bolder, and we need to move faster. That was my message to other leaders - and to the world - at @COP26UK today. I spoke about the work we’ve done in Canada to tackle this crisis: we’ve put a price on pollution, we’ve doubled our climate financing, we’re making sure all new cars and passenger trucks are zero-emission by 2035, and much more. I also announced that we’re supporting the global phase-out of thermal coal, helping developing countries transition to clean fuel alternatives as quickly as possible, and cutting pollution in the oil and gas sector - and I called on other countries to do the same. Because words aren’t enough to secure strong economies for our countries and bright futures for our kids. Together, we need to deliver ambitious action and real results. We’ll continue to work with our partners around the world to do exactly that.
🇨🇦
L’action climatique ne peut attendre. On doit en faire plus, on doit être plus ambitieux et on doit agir plus vite. C’est le message que j’ai transmis aux autres dirigeants - et au reste du monde - à la @COP26UK, aujourd’hui. J’ai parlé du travail qu’on a fait au Canada pour lutter contre la crise: on a mis un prix sur la pollution, on a doublé le financement international que l’on accorde à la lutte contre les changements climatiques, on veille à ce que les nouvelles voitures et les nouveaux camions légers soient carboneutres d’ici 2035, et plus encore.
