Among friends tonight after a busy first day. #G7

Entre amis ce soir après une première journée chargée. #G7

Busy working start at the G7 Leaders’ Summit in Japan. 
Beaucoup de travail en ce début du Sommet du G7 au Japon.

Our government is focused on creating the good-paying jobs that strengthen Canada’s middle class – and our team spent time with the heads of 3 Japanese automakers today to discuss innovation and investment in our country.

Notre gouvernement cherche à créer des emplois bien rémunérés qui renforcent la classe moyenne au Canada – et notre équipe a passé du temps aujourd’hui avec les dirigeants de 3 fabricants japonais d’automobiles pour parler d’innovation et d’investissement dans notre pays.

Ceremonial sake at the Meiji shrine this morning in Tokyo. Sophie and I were honoured to visit and pay respects.

Cérémonie du saké au sanctuaire Meiji ce matin, à Tokyo. Sophie et moi sommes honorés d’avoir visité les lieux et présenté nos hommages.

A warm welcome in Japan as we arrive for an official working visit and the #G7 Leaders’ Summit.

Nous avons été chaleureusement accueillis au Japon pour notre visite de travail officielle et le Sommet du #G7.

Great to welcome our Ukrainian Parliamentary interns in traditional style. Welcome to the Hill. 
Enchanté de voir nos stagiaires parlementaires ukrainiens, vêtus à la mode traditionnelle. Bienvenue sur la Colline.

90 percent of Fort McMurray was saved from the flames. This city will be back.

Les flammes ont épargné 90 % de Fort McMurray. La ville reprendra vie.

With fire Chief Darby Allen, Premier Rachel Notley, and the heroes of #ymmfire. From all Canadians, thank you. 
Avec le chef des pompiers Darby Allen, la PM Rachel Notley et les héros de #ymmfire. Tout le Canada vous dit merci.

Over Fort Mac today. We owe our gratitude to the firefighters who worked so hard to preserve and protect the city.

Survol de Fort Mac aujourd’hui. Nous sommes reconnaissants aux pompiers qui ont tant fait pour protéger la ville.

I got the long-form. Did you? There’s still time to fill out #Census2016 so do it today!

J’ai reçu le formulaire long. Et vous? Il est encore temps de participer au #recensement2016... Faites-le aujourd’hui!

Getting down to work in Wednesday caucus – discussing the #FortMacFire and issues from across the country.

On se met au travail lors du caucus de mercredi – nous parlons des #FeuxFortMac et d’enjeux touchant tout le pays.

Big news: Canada & the @GlobalFund will host health leaders from around the world this summer in the fight against AIDS, TB & Malaria. Canada is boosting its pledge to the Global Fund through 2019 -  with money that will help save an additional 8 million lives. Preventable, curable disease still kills millions around the world. It’s time to #EndItForGood. Details: bit.ly/1TzPxDF

De grandes nouvelles: Le Canada et le @GlobalFund luttent contre le sida, la tuberculose et le paludisme cet été. Le Canada donne davantage au @GlobalFund jusqu’en 2019 -  pour sauver 8 millions de vies de plus. Des maladies évitables, guérissables, tuent encore des millions de gens dans le monde. #EnFinirPourDeBon. À lire ici : bit.ly/1TOAOrD

We will get through this tragedy together – as friends. As neighbours. As Canadians. The Government of Canada will match individual donations made to the Canadian Red Cross in support of disaster relief efforts in Fort McMurray. #ymmfire

Nous traverserons cette épreuve ensemble, amis, voisins, Canadiens que nous sommes. Le gouvernement du Canada fera un don équivalent pour chaque subside remis à la Croix-Rouge canadienne pour appuyer les efforts déployés à Fort McMurray.

Prince Harry and I joined Team Canada members yesterday to announce the 2017 @InvictusToronto Games. The Games are a reflection of his commitment to our veterans. 
J'ai senti une belle énergie en me joignant au prince Harry et à Équipe Canada pour annoncer les Jeux @InvictusToronto 2017! Les Jeux sont un reflet de l'engagement du prince envers nos vétérans.

#tbt to the little one meeting our newest arrival a few months ago. Say hello to Kenzie.

#tbt à notre tout-petit qui rencontrait notre nouveau venu il y a quelques mois. Dites bonjour à Kenzie.

“I hope to provide inspiration to other Indigenous peoples. Since being crowned Mrs. Universe last summer, I cherish my role as an advocate for the Indigenous community. I attended university to pursue a Bachelor of Arts degree focusing on drama and acting/television, and I believe that education played a key role in my acting career. I continue to advocate for all levels of Indigenous education by speaking across North America at places such as Harvard University, University of Toronto, TED Talks, WE Day and many more. I’m not your typical beauty queen - I have a voice for change and I am using it! -@ashleycallingbull 
#Budget2016 invests $2.6B over five years to improve primary and high schools on reserve – a major step towards making sure every young First Nations student receives a quality education #EducationCan « J’espère être une inspiration pour d’autres Autochtones. Depuis que j’ai été couronnée Miss Univers l’été dernier, je chéris mon rôle de porte-parole pour la communauté autochtone. J’ai fait des études universitaires pour décrocher un baccalauréat ès arts axé sur l’art dramatique et la télévision, et je crois que mes études ont joué un rôle crucial dans ma carrière de comédienne. Je continue de promouvoir les études à tous les niveaux auprès des Autochtones en faisant des allocutions aux quatre coins de l’Amérique du Nord dans des endroits comme l’Université Harvard, l’Université de Toronto, les discussions TED, et la journée nationale « Unis pour l’action », entre autres. Je ne suis pas une reine de beauté comme les autres – je peux prendre la parole pour favoriser le changement, et je le fais! -@ashleycallingbull 
Le #Budget2016 prévoit un investissement de 2.6 milliards de dollars sur cinq ans pour améliorer les écoles primaires et secondaires dans les réserves – un grand pas pour veiller à ce que chaque élève des Premières Nations reçoive une éducation de qualité #ÉducationCan

Productive & respectful discussion at the File Hills Qu’Appelle Tribal Council. Thanks FHQTC for the warm welcome.

Discussion productive et respectueuse au Conseil tribal File Hills Qu’Appelle. Merci FHQTC de l’accueil chaleureux.

“My education has been instrumental in fueling my career and success. From SciTech and IBT programs in middle school, AP classes and financial aid at the Bishop Strachan School in Toronto, to co-op terms and scholarships at Dalhousie University, schooling was how I put down roots for my future path. In 2015 I was hired full-time as an educator at Microsoft, and through support from Microsoft and Dal's incredible Faculty of Computer Science I have been able to kickstart my career while I finish my undergrad. I am so grateful to have been able to take advantage of the amazing programs our education systems provide.” –Sage Franch, @thetrendytechie 
In #Budget2016, we committed to strengthening Canada’s middle class and those working hard to join it - because making sure young Canadians have access to education, jobs and training is key to building the economy of the future. To read the full budget or get the highlights, click the link in the bio. #EducationCan « Mes études ont joué un rôle essentiel dans ma carrière et ma réussite. Qu’il s’agisse du programme de sciences et technologie ou du programme international de commerce et de technologie à l’école intermédiaire, des cours du programme avancé et de l’aide financière à l’école Bishop Strachan de Toronto ou des sessions de stage et des bourses de l’Université Dalhousie, mes études m’ont permis de jeter les fondements de mon cheminement ultérieur. En 2015, j’ai été embauchée à temps plein comme éducatrice chez Microsoft et, grâce à l’appui de Microsoft et à l’incroyable faculté de sciences informatiques de l’Université de Dalhousie, j’ai été en mesure de donner le coup d’envoi à ma carrière en finissant mes études de premier cycle. Je suis très reconnaissante d’avoir pu tirer profit des formidables programmes offerts par nos systèmes d’éducation. » –Sage Franch, @thetrendytechie 
Dans le #Budget2016, nous nous sommes engagés à renforcer la classe moyenne du Canada et les personnes qui travaillent fort pour s’y joindre – et le fait de veiller à ce que les jeunes Canadiens aient accès aux études, à des emplois et à de la formation est essentiel pour bâtir l’économie de l’avenir. En savoir plus: budget.gc.ca

"I hope to use my education at the University of Toronto's political science program to create meaningful change in our communities, and it's long been my dream to pursue a political career on the municipal level. During the summers in my hometown of Calgary, I apply what I have learned by working for a not-for profit that inspires a love of literature in readers of all ages, especially underprivileged students. This job has not only allowed me to keep learning over the summer, but also given myself an opportunity to enter the workforce with experience in a relative field." -@johnnnyrich 
In #Budget2016 we're boosting investment in the Youth Employment Strategy to help young Canadians get much-needed job experience. The new money will create green jobs, boost the Skills Link program, and increase opportunities in the Young Canada Works program. Get the details here: 
bit.ly/1SYz5N3
#EducationCan « J'espère me servir de mes études en sciences politiques à l'Université de Toronto pour opérer un changement significatif dans nos communautés et je rêve depuis longtemps de faire carrière en politique municipale. Je passe mes étés, dans ma ville natale de Calgary, à mettre en pratique ce que j'ai appris en travaillant pour une organisation à but non lucratif qui inspire l'amour de la littérature à des lecteurs de tous les âges, spécialement aux personnes défavorisées. Non seulement ce travail me permet de continuer à apprendre pendant l'été, mais il me permet aussi d'entrer sur le marché du travail dans un domaine connexe. » -@johnnnyrichDans le #Budget2016, nous  augmentons l'investissement dans la Stratégie Emploi Jeunesse pour aider les jeunes Canadiens à acquérir une très nécessaire expérience. L'argent supplémentaire servira à créer des emplois verts, à rehausser le programme Connexion compétences et à multiplier les possibilités offertes par le programme Jeunesse Canada au travail. Vous trouverez les détails ici : bit.ly/1YPldsR

'Gaining an education in physics and engineering has allowed me to follow my dreams and work in the space industry, specifically on human spaceflight. Through my education and related internships, I’ve been fortunate to contribute to projects including a spacesuit, worn on the International Space Station (ISS), that aims to improve spinal health in space and work in Germany’s version of Mission Control." -@vmarwaha

Getting early work experience is crucial to building a career. That's why #Budget2016 doubled the size of the Canada Summer Jobs program for students, helping create nearly 70,000 jobs a year for young people in each of the next 3 years. « Mes études en physique et en génie m'ont permis de réaliser mes rêves et de travailler dans l'industrie de l'aérospatiale, plus spécifiquement en lien avec les vols spatiaux habités. Grâce à mes études et aux stages qui s'y rattachaient, j'ai eu la chance de contribuer à des projets, par exemple un projet de combinaison spatiale, portée dans la station spatiale internationale (SSI) pour améliorer la santé vertébrale dans l'espace, et de travailler à la version allemande du contrôle de mission. » -@vmarwaha

Il est essentiel d'acquérir rapidement de l'expérience de travail pour faire carrière. C'est pourquoi le #Budget2016 double le montant du programme Emplois d'été Canada pour les étudiants, aidant ainsi à créer près de 70 000 emplois par an pour des jeunes, pour chacune des trois prochaines années. #EducationCan

“You never know what you’ll do after completing your education! I attended the University of Saskatchewan to complete Education and Arts & Science degrees. After that, I started an award-winning company called @NeechieGear that gives 5% of profits to help underprivileged youth take part in sports. I'm grateful for what I do, and if I hadn’t gone to university, I wouldn't have been exposed to the business competitions that allowed me to give entrepreneurship a try.” -@KendalNetmaker 
#Budget2016 changes Canada Student Loan rules so that no one will have to begin repayments until they’re making at least $25,000/year. We’re committed to creating opportunity for young people looking to succeed. #EducationCan « On ne sait jamais d'avance ce qu'on fera après nos études ! J'ai étudié à l'Université de la Saskatchewan pour obtenir des diplômes en éducation, en arts et en sciences. Par la suite, j'ai lancé une entreprise primée, appelée @NeechieGear, dont 5 % des profits vont à des jeunes défavorisés, pour les aider à faire du sport. Je suis heureux de ce que je fais et si je n'étais pas allé à l'université, je n'aurais pas pu participer aux concours qui m'ont permis de tenter ma chance comme entrepreneur. » -@KendalNetmaker

Le #Budget2016 change les règles du Prêt d'études canadien de façon à ce que personne n'ait à commencer à le rembourser avant de gagner au moins 25 000 $/an. Nous sommes déterminés à donner aux jeunes qui cherchent à réussir la possibilité de le faire. #EducationCan

Canada has officially signed the Paris Agreement on #ClimateChange!

Le Canada a officiellement signé l’Accord de Paris sur les #changementsclimatiques.

“I started my organization while still in high school, and I am so deeply grateful for that entire experience and where it has lead me today. Getting to speak with tens of thousands of girls across Canada every single year is a dream come true, and it all started because of the opportunities and skills provided to me during my high school years, and the support of my high school community. I never felt for a second that my goals or dreams were out of reach or in any way impossible.” @Kate_Whitfield, founder of @fearlesslygirl This week I announced that as Minister of Youth, I’m creating a Youth Council of Canadians aged 16-24, to inform our government and have their voices heard. You have so much to give – stay tuned for details on how to participate. #EducationCan « J’ai commencé mon organisation lorsque j’étais encore à l’école secondaire. Je suis très profondément reconnaissante pour tout ce que cette expérience m’a apporté et qu’elle m’ait conduite jusqu’ici aujourd’hui. Pouvoir parler à des dizaines de milliers de filles au Canada tous les ans est un rêve devenu réalité. Tout a commencé grâce aux possibilités et aux compétences que j’ai acquises à l’école secondaire, ainsi qu’au soutien des gens de mon école secondaire. Je n’ai jamais eu l’impression que mes objectifs ou mes rêves étaient inaccessibles ou impossibles. » @Kate_Whitfield, fondatrice de @fearlesslygirl Cette semaine, j’ai annoncé qu’à titre de ministre de la Jeunesse, je crée un Conseil des jeunes Canadiens, de 16 à 24 ans, pour informer notre gouvernement et pour faire entendre leurs voix. Vous avez tant à apporter – surveillez les détails sur la manière de participer, qui suivront. #EducationCan

At @gleasonsgym in Brooklyn, @give_a_kid_a_dream_gleasons gets kids off the street and into the ring. Thanks for welcoming me to train with them today. 
Au @gleasonsgym de Brooklyn, avec @give_a_kid_a_dream_gleasons, les enfants sortent de la rue pour entrer dans le ring. Merci de m’avoir accueilli pour m’entraîner avec eux aujourd’hui.

“Mentorship and education are hugely important to me. When I started my company @getBitness at age 15, I struggled to find mentors my age. Now, as a Grade 12 student at @trulySacredHeart in Halifax, I’ve partnered with @voltalabs to offer a safe and collaborative space - @hoisthalifax - to educate and inspire teens in Grades 7 through 12 interested in business, technology and design. The next step of my education is to pursue a Bachelor of Commerce degree at @ubcaplaceofmind, thanks to a scholarship from @loranscholar. I’m grateful for the opportunities my education has provided me, and I believe that education is something that should be continuously pursued at every stage of life.”
-@theAlexGillis 
Every young person should have the chance to go to college or university. That’s why we’re increasing Canada Student Grants by $1000/year for students from low and middle-income families in #Budget2016 « Le mentorat et les études sont énormément importants pour moi. Quand j’ai lancé mon entreprise @getBitness, à l’âge de 15 ans, j’ai eu du mal à trouver des mentors de mon âge. Je suis maintenant en 12e année à l’école @trulySacredHeart, à Halifax, et j’ai conclu un partenariat avec @voltalabs pour offrir un espace sûr de collaboration, @hoisthalifax, qui sert à instruire et à inspirer les élèves de la 7e année à la 12e année s’intéressant aux affaires, à la technologie et au design. Pour ce qui est de la prochaine étape de mes études, j’ai l’intention de faire un baccalauréat en commerce à @ubcaplaceofmind, grâce à une bourse d’études de @loranscholar. Je suis reconnaissant des possibilités que m’ont ouvertes mes études et je crois qu’il faut continuellement s’instruire, à toutes les étapes de la vie. » -@theAlexGillis 
Tous les jeunes devraient pouvoir aller au collège ou à l’université. C’est pourquoi nous augmentons de 1000 $/an les Bourses d’études canadiennes pour les étudiants des familles à revenu faible pou moyen dans le #Budget2016

“My lifelong dream is to travel to space, and my education in mechanical and aerospace engineering has helped me pursue it. During my undergrad I helped design and build a solar-powered car that I raced across North America. I learned how to fly, experimented with flames in simulated microgravity in grad school, and interned at NASA. Now I work with space robots. My hope is that my stories will help fight outdated stereotypes about women in STEM, and inspire young women to pursue their own ambitious careers where the sky is not the limit.” @natalie_panek 
Education on the cutting edge is vital to Canada – and our young people’s futures. That’s why Budget 2016 invests $2 billion over three years to improve labs and buildings on campuses across the country. Click the link in the bio to find out more. #EducationCan « Le rêve de ma vie est de voyager dans l’espace, et mes études en génie mécanique et aérospatial m’ont aidée à le réaliser. Durant mes études de premier cycle, j’ai contribué à la conception et à la fabrication d’une voiture alimentée à l’énergie solaire avec laquelle j’ai participé à des courses aux quatre coins de l’Amérique du Nord. J’ai appris à piloter, j’ai fait des expériences avec des flammes en microgravité simulée durant mes études supérieures, et j’ai été stagiaire à la NASA. Aujourd’hui, je travaille avec des robots spatiaux.  J’espère que mon témoignage aidera à combattre les stéréotypes démodés au sujet des femmes dans les domaines des STIM, et encouragera de jeunes femmes à entreprendre elles-mêmes une carrière ambitieuse dans laquelle rien n’est impossible. » @natalie_panek 
L’éducation de pointe est vitale pour le Canada – et pour l’avenir de nos jeunes. C’est pourquoi le Budget 2016 prévoit un investissement de 2 milliards de dollars sur trois ans destiné à l’amélioration des laboratoires et des immeubles dans des campus de partout au pays.

Budget 2016 ensures that young Canadians have the education and job experience they need to realize their brightest future, and this week, some young exceptional Canadians are taking over my IG! They’re entrepreneurs, scientists and community leaders, and they’ll be talking about how education has fueled their success. Follow along or share your story with the hashtag #EducationCan

Le Budget 2016 assure que les jeunes Canadiennes et Canadiens auront l'éducation et l'expérience de travail nécessaires pour réaliser tout le meilleur pour leur avenir. Cette semaine, de jeunes Canadiens exceptionnels s’emparent de mon compte Instagram! Ces entrepreneurs, scientifiques et leaders dans leur communauté nous expliquent comment l’éducation a nourri leur réussite. Suivez-les ou faites-nous part de votre propre histoire en utilisant le mot-clic #ÉducationCan.

Top Chef winner. Iron Chef winner. Prime Minister. #StayTuned #ExploreCanada 
Championne Top Chef. Champion Iron Chef. Premier ministre. #suivezlefil #explorezsansfin

Greetings from Prof. Stephen Hawking at #Perimeter today in Waterloo.

Salutations du prof. Stephen Hawking à #Perimeter aujourd’hui à Waterloo.

An unexpected splash of water from @magna_int staff in Guelph. Happy #Songkran 
Je suis aspergé d'eau par le personnel de @magna_int à Guelph. Heureux #Songkran !

#‎tbt to the Liberal Leadership Convention on April 14th, 2013. It’s been an incredible three years. I’m proud of the work we’ve done together. ‪#‎tbt‬ à la course à la chefferie le 14 avril 2013. Ce fut trois années incroyables. Je suis fier du travail que nous avons fait ensemble.

Great to meet with MPs from our Pacific, Quebec & Atlantic caucuses before our regular national Wednesday session today…

Ravi de rencontrer les députés de nos caucus du Pacifique, du Québec et de l’Atlantique avant notre séance nationale régulière du mercredi...

Great to be at Vaisakhi on the Hill today! I’m proud to celebrate the remarkable contributions of Sikh Canadians.

Belle célébration de Vaisakhi sur la Colline! Fier de célébrer les contributions remarquables des Canadiens sikhs.

Our major investments in public transit will help people in cities like Montreal – and across the country - get to where they need to go, faster and more efficiently. Click the link in the bio for more.

Nos importants investissements dans le transport public aideront les gens dans les villes comme Montréal – et partout au pays - à se rendre là où ils doivent aller plus vite et plus efficacement. Cliquez sur le lien dans la bio pour en savoir plus.

Hat? Check. It's Opening Week. Let's come together again and support the @BlueJays! #OurMoment #CapsOn
Casquette ? Coché. La saison débute cette semaine. Retournons soutenir ensemble les @BlueJays! #OurMoment #CapsOn

My thanks to @barackobama for hosting a friendly, focused and productive #NSS2016 summit!

Merci @barackobama pour le Sommet sur la sécurité nucléaire 2016, qui fut convivial, ciblé et productif!

Great to see Indian PM @narendramodi again today at #NSS2016, discussing nuclear security & economic growth. 
Ravi de revoir le PM de l’Inde @narendramodi au #NSS2016 pour discuter de sécurité et de croissance économique.

Squeezing in a quick run between meetings today in DC. Let’s hope T-shirt weather comes to Canada before long... Quelques pas de course entre deux réunions à Washington. Espérons que le beau temps sera bientôt de la partie au Canada...

On behalf of our family, Sophie and I would like to wish all Canadians a very Happy #Easter.

Au nom de notre famille, Sophie et moi souhaitons à tous les Canadiens de très joyeuses #Pâques.

Great to see the Rose family again today. #Budget2016 gives them - and 9 of 10 Canadian families - more in child benefits.

J'ai été ravi de revoir les Rose. Le #Budget2016 augmente les allocations pour enfants de 9 familles sur 10.

#Budget2016 is a long-term plan to strengthen the heart of Canada’s economy – the middle class: budget.gc.ca 
Le #Budget2016 est un plan à long terme pour la classe moyenne, qui est au cœur de l’économie canadienne: budget.gc.ca

We're all on this planet together. During #EarthHour and every day thereafter. Read more: earthhour.org • Nous vivons tous ensemble sur cette planète, à l’#heuredelaterre et le reste du temps: earthhour.org

There's still much work to be done toward gender equality. Thank you #CatalystAwards2016 for honouring me last night. •  Il reste encore beaucoup à faire pour l’égalité des sexes. Merci @CatalystInc pour l’hommage d’hier soir.

Great to get a taste of Montreal in New York! Merci de m’avoir accueilli.

Another week, another proud encounter with @justinpjtrudeau, Canada's freshest Prime Minister. Thanks to these amazing people for making the Prime Minster's lunch so memorable!
Canada will once again demonstrate real leadership on a number of @unitednations priorities.
Le Canada exercera à nouveau un vrai leadership en lien avec un certain nombre de priorités de l’ONU.

My thanks to the @tccsings Toronto Children’s Chorus for the moving performance today in New York.

Merci à la Chorale des enfants de Toronto pour la prestation émouvante d’aujourd’hui à New York.

Today I’m pleased to announce Canada will pursue a seat on the @unitednations Security Council for the 2021-2022 term. We’re determined to revitalize Canada’s role as a key contributor to @unitednations peacekeeping, and to help advance current reform efforts.

Aujourd’hui, je suis ravi d’annoncer que le Canada cherchera à obtenir un siège au Conseil de sécurité des Nations unies pour 2021-2022. Nous entendons refaire du Canada un acteur essentiel des efforts de maintien de la paix de l’ONU et aider aux réformes en cours.

So long, friends. Come visit anytime - we've got a big birthday coming up. #Canada150 
Au revoir, chers amis. Passez nous voir quand vous voudrez; un important anniversaire arrive bientôt. #Canada150

Le Can. et les É.-U. envisagent une économie nord-américaine prospère et durable. Notre déclaration conjointe : bit.ly/1U5jDEz

Formidable d’être à Washington! Je me réjouis à l’idée de rencontrer @barackobama & de resserrer les liens entre nos pays.

Today I had the pleasure to unveil the names of the Toronto Zoo’s panda cubs! Say hello to Jia Panpan (Canadian Hope) & Jia Yueyue (Canadian Joy). J’ai eu le plaisir aujourd'hui de dévoiler le nom des bébés pandas du Zoo de Toronto ! Bonjour Jia Panpan (espoir canadien) et Jia Yueyue (joie canadienne).

Thank you Tsuut’ina Nation for honouring me with a bonnet transfer ceremony today. An experience I won't forget. 
Merci à Tsuut’ina Nation de m’avoir honoré lors de la cérémonie du transfert du bonnet. Une expérience inoubliable.

Thrilled to see my mother honoured at the @simonfraseru Outstanding Alumni awards. She will always be an inspiration. 
Enchanté de voir ma mère honorée aux prix des anciens exceptionnels de @simonfraseru. Elle sera toujours une inspiration.

Les premiers ministres ont convenu d’un plan hardi pour créer une économie plus propre: bit.ly/1QvT99p

We’re underway at the First Ministers’ Meeting in Vancouver. Busy day ahead.

Notre rencontre des premiers ministres est en cours à Vancouver. Journée occupée en perspective.

Good work today with Premiers and Indigenous leaders from across the country - talking jobs, climate & clean growth.

Du bon travail aujourd’hui avec les pm et les dirigeants autochtones du pays : emplois, climat et croissance propre.

The future is happening now and Canada needs to be a part of it. We're kicking off a week focused on clean growth for the economy & environment. Thanks @SmartProsperity for hosting today. #NewThinking 
Le futur, c’est maintenant et le Canada doit en faire partie. J’amorce une semaine axée sur la croissance propre, pour l’économie et l’environnement. Merci à @SmartProsperity. #IntelliProsperité

Happy Boxing Day! Or as we here in America call it: Steve Zahn Appreciation Day! 
I got to catch up with one of my favorite actors on the latest ep of “Life Is Short” podcast. Steve is one of those actors who is ALWAYS so committed and so interesting to watch, no matter what he’s doing - whether it’s my latest TV obsession “White Lotus” on @hbomax or the goofy stoner comedy we made “Strange Wilderness” many years ago (pic 4 - and yes, I obviously kept the sweater ;)
We talk about how he became an actor, his family life (far from showbiz) on a farm in Kentucky, cracking up with Christian Bale on “Rescue Dawn”, and we reminisce about the old days on and off camera :)
It was just great to catch up with my old friend and have the opportunity to ask him some nerdy fan questions I’d always been curious about. I hope you all enjoy it! Listen wherever you listen to podcasts! #SteveZahnPahdcast

Pre-Covid memories: when I was able to overcome a childhood fear of sitting on Santa’s lap (while challenging this Santa to overcome his own issues of being too close to another adult man). Happy holidays, everyone!

BYOBathsalts! Making “Strange Wilderness” was VERY serious work 🎭 🏆#tbt 

(Check out the GREAT @stevezahn on the latest episode of “Life is Short” podcast. He’s one of my favorite actors… and people… and now podcast guests :)

A @dodgers shirt on a podcast hosted by a @mets fan??? Well… She IS the boss! And we’re CHARMED to have @milano_alyssa as our latest guest on “Life is Short” podcast! The only stipulation for Alyssa to appear was that we agreed to not do any dumb puns about the iconic shows she’s been on! 😬 We talk about her classic TV series, growing up as a famous teenager and how a moment with a brave fan (Ryan White) helped pave the way for a life of activism. Whether or not you agree with her, Alyssa definitely uses her voice + platform to speak out against or in support of many politically sensitive issues. She also talks about raising children, her own (VERY different) upbringing and her OWN childhood crush (hint: his first name is C.)
I hope you all enjoy it and, if you don’t, in the spirit of the holiday season, I also hope you keep any negative feelings to yourself 😌🙏🎄
‘Tis the season 🎥🍿🎄💛
My social media team told me I should post more selfies… and that’s what I pay all 24 of them to do!

The GREEEAT Alan Cumming graces us with his puckishly charming presence on “Life is Short” podcast! @alancummingsnaps and I discuss his impressive career, the sandwich he began the interview by finishing (pic #2), a chimpanzee he once worked with who fell in love with him, and his VERY engaging new book “Baggage” (a great holiday gift for fans of Alan, acting, life wisdom and/or hilarious stories). Alan has always been a brilliantly committed performer (his Emcee in “Cabaret” was one of the most memorable theater experiences I’ve had) and a fearlessly outspoken member of the LGBTQ community. One of the most enjoyable talks I’ve had on the show. Hope you guys like it! P.s. @poodollar72 and I discuss his favorite @skittles flavors… again 😘💛🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿

Making the traditional Thanksgiving hummus! 😋

Easy vegan side: 1 can garbanzo beans, olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, salt, pepper, water (depending on your fav consistency), parsley, tahini (optional - I just sprinkled some sesame seeds in), anything else you want (play w the flavors - but remember: if you add turkey it’s no longer considered vegan) and then BLEND! 
Spatula by: @thetinychefshow and @nokidhungry, Fanny pack (NOT optional - REQUIRED) by @stjude, hair by @ActualBedHead

MOST sneezes are involuntary ;) Thankful for my #VoluntarySneeze skills I’ve been honing over the years 🤧🦃And thankful to all the “shorties” who’ve been listening to our “Life is Short” podcast! @poodollar72 and I wanted to post this video to thank you for LETTING us do this show that we love so much and to ask your help in revising some of our lightning round questions - we’d like to change some up in the new year. Comment below, if you have any ideas! Thanks so much! And Happy Thanksgiving! Gobble Gobble @nicholasbraun! 😘🦃🦃🦃

New sitcom? Or an ol’ fashioned pose-off w one of my favorites @joe_gatto? (And latest “Life is Short” podcast guest!) Joe is a member of @impracticaljokersofficial - a show that listeners of our podcast are probably sick of hearing me talk about. But I love it and I love Joe and was SO excited to talk to him (though I truly felt like I already knew him). We talk about some of the jokes that went south, some stuff they didn’t air, but we also get into some surprisingly heavy life/death territory (Joe lost his dad at an early age and he’s pleasantly candid about how that’s affected his own relationship to death, fatherhood and enhanced his ability to live each day to the fullest). He’s also a huge animal rescue proponent - with a rescue menagerie of his own (all named after Italian pastries). He’s impossible not to be charmed by - haha I challenge ALL OF YOU! Listen to my talk with Joe on “Life is Short” podcast wherever you listen to other podcasts ❤️🐶

F is for Fifth and Final Season! It’s been such a joy voicing Kevin (+ Chuck + especially Phinneas 🤡) these past 5 seasons! Thank you to everyone who watched + kept us streaming along and to my dear “F is For Family”… family @wilfredburr @lauradern @debiderryberry + @haleyreinhart (who helped me download this trailer 😬👴🏻). Also the GREAT @nph joins us this year! Cannot go wrong with NPH. EVER. Coming to Netflix on Thursday, November 25!

Fun night out w @chefaz + @gailsimmonseats for an INCREDIBLE org @childreninconflict + @warchilduk - 2 groups that are the first in and THE LAST TO LEAVE in conflict zones where children are most at risk. The keynote speaker was @mosidibay, a former child soldier-turned successful corporate attorney (🤯) from Sierra Leone, who said that the only thing separating anyone in that privileged room from any child in one of these horrible war zones is opportunity. Very few are lucky enough to be given that opportunity but by supporting groups like @childreninconflict + @warchildusa, you’re creating more of just that for these kids who have all the potential in the world (as is evidenced by Mohamed and the other success stories of rehabilitated child soldiers). I’m going to put the link in my bio! 
(Also: @brandicarlile sang some songs from her new album “In These Silent Days” that I then immediately purchased and have not stopped listening to since ❤️)
Working at Hooters w Billy Crudup #tbt #BreakingTheGlass…Floor?

The hilarious and delightful Bobby Moynihan is our guest on a hilarious and delightful episode of “Life is Short” podcast! Bobby is best known for his stellar career on @nbcsnl but he’s done incredible work in “The Secret Life of Pets”, “Mr Mayor” (Bobby talks about how disgusted he is by Ted Danson), “Sisters” (in which he plays a humorless guy high on cocaine in one of the single funniest scenes I’ve ever seen). We talk about his career, his new(er) life as a father and his love of Star Wars. Bobby also gives me the scoop on how he created one of my favorite SNL characters, Drunk Uncle. I hope my own Uncle Dick Long enjoys his shout-out! And I hope the rest of you enjoy my catch-up with my old pal @bibbymoynihan 🙏

When the world’s greatest magician tells you how he cut off the tip of his finger doing a trick (and it wasn’t a finger removal trick)🤭 On the latest ep of “Life is Short” podcast, David Copperfield also tells me about how he first became passionate about illusionism and how far that passion has now taken him. And he tricks me into being excited about his new book “History Of Magic” - a fascinating-sounding profile of 28 ground-breaking magicians. He was so easy and fun to talk to… but maybe that was just an illusion… 🪄🤔
Pic #2 is from LAST week’s episode (I’ve been on a vacation/ instabreak :) with the delightful @annaleighashford. I became a proud new member of the Tucci gang! The GREAT Stanley Tucci graces us w his charming, erudite company on “Life is Short” podcast. His new book “Taste”, a memoir told through his experiences with food + cooking, is as enjoyable as the author himself. I can’t even believe I’m trying to sell this episode- it’s Stanley Tucci! The 🐐! He’s always been one of my favorite actors and now I can confidently say he’s also one of my favorite guests. The TV show “Ed” premiered 21 years ago today 🤯 It remains the happiest professional time of my life. It was like the most fun on-camera acting school imaginable (as I was acting school age and COMPLETELY inexperienced) - learning from the best @cavanaghtom @itsjuliebowen @darylchillmitchell (why were we always snuggling up in the publicity photos?? Probably because I loved being around you :) and the whole cast of pros. I’ll always cherish that time and those experiences and am forever grateful to @robburnett1 and casting director (and fairy godmother) @bonnieezane (and her sister, Debra, who saw me do three lines in the pilot and cast me in “Galaxy Quest”). Hopefully it comes out on a streaming service one day - not sure why it hasn’t but I think it has something to do with the incredible (and pricey!) music they used in the show. I always love the interactions I have with people who know and enjoy that show 🎳❤️#fbf

When you grow up watching somebody grow up on TV and then talk to them 30 years later about ACTUALLY growing up #relatable? 🙄 @fredsavage is our VERY special guest on “Life is Short” - a podcast hosted by 2 guys (me + @poodollar72) who watched “The Wonder Years” RELIGIOUSLY. 
Despite my excessive fangirling, Fred could not have been more patient and kind and game to talk about ALL of his great work (including, of course, “The Princess Bride”) the upcoming reboot of @wonderyearsabc, how he remained so grounded and unaffected by his childhood fame, and how he’s shepherding his own kids through their OWN wonder years. This was a truly surreal and special one for me - I hope you all enjoy it :) 
☝️Ideally, this whole thing should be read by the great @realdanielstern 🙏❤️
As a HUGE #BackToTheFuture fan, I had to play it VERY cool when I got to work w the wonderful @lea_thompson - mission accomplished, I think! #fbf #FlashBackToTheFutureFridays

Don’t judge me! Who WOULDN’T be smitten by @ryanphillippe?!?! - listen to the latest “Life is Short” podcast and you’ll see! He’s as funny as he is hunky. 👈that’s a poem by me, the co-director of Ryan’s latest movie #LadyOfTheManor, in which Ryan plays the VERY douchey character, Tanner - a kind of grown up (barely) version of his breakout role in “Cruel Intentions”. In actuality, Ryan is VERY different from these affluenza-stricken characters he excels at playing. We talk about his very middle-class upbringing outside  Philadelphia, his love of SNL, his decision to play the first openly gay character on daytime TV (during a time when it was still VERY taboo to do so), and his thoughts on fatherhood in the spotlight, how much has changed since his early experience with fame and how to navigate the new social media landscape. 
And, of course, Ryan talks about my most anticipated new show “MacGruber” (this Xmas 🎄 🙏🙏🙏) and he lets me geek out about the BRILLIANT 2010 movie on which it’s based - and in which Ryan gives a truly underrated, HILARIOUS performance opposite two of the funniest ever: @orviv + Kristen Wiig. If you’ve never seen it, do yourself a favor and watch it immediately (immediately AFTER you watch @lionsgate’s #LadyOfTheManor which is now available on Blu-ray!) #RyanPhillipost
My spirit animal 💛🐸🇪🇪

In honor of @scottspeedman reluctantly joining Instagram, here are some candid photos of us from my personal archives! Welcome, Scott! If ya can’t beat em, join em, eh? 😘🇨🇦 #tbt (that means “throwback Thursday”, Scott - it’s when you post an old photo because you’re too lazy / boring to post a new current one 👍)

I’ve been in love with this man’s acting since I saw “Carlito’s Way” as a high school student in the early 90’s. That love deepened with “Boogie Nights” and “Punchdrunk Love” and ALL the great parts in Adam Sandler’s movies. He was kind enough to grace us with his hilarious and legendary presence for one day on our little movie #LadyOfTheManor. It was a pure favor. He flew all the way down from Vermont to Tampa just to do a little part that he was WAY overqualified to be doing. It also happened to be the most stressful day (the only TRULY stressful day) of our shoot. We were struggling to maintain a sense of fun and control. Luis did something to help us that day that I’ll never forget. He confronted the source of our stress - a toxic person with a toxic agenda. Then, he took us aside and, with calm and YEARS of movie-making wisdom in his voice, he reminded us why it was that we wanted to make a movie in the first place. He brought the fun back into what was always meant to be a fun thing. Luis reminded us to experience the joy of making a movie. And we did. And I’ll always be so grateful to my friend, the LEGEND: Louey Lou, for giving us that gift ❤️🇵🇷 #ExperienceTheJoy

We pushed our movie baby out today! Rent, buy or get it on @appletv @itunes or Amazon before it’s cinematic placenta dries! #Sorry4ThatVisual! 

Too many people to thank for letting us turn a stoned idea my brother and I had one night 3 years ago into an actual movie - from the INCREDIBLE crew in Tampa, to the cast of actors I’ve admired for years (and some I newly admire) to the FOOLS who gave us 1 million dollars to make the movie, to musician friends who provided great music and, of course, to @lionsgate for releasing it. This all came from a moment of laughter we had one night, so I hope it provides you with some tonight (or whenever you watch it :) 
Thanks to everyone involved - you all know who you are and @poodollar72 and I are eternally grateful 👻👻👻❤️🍿

Tomorrow everyone can see this lady’s BRILLIANT performance in #LadyOfTheManor! #tbt @msmelanielynskey, one of our most accomplished, classy actresses, plays a crass, pot-smoking slacker who gets a job as a tour guide at a historic manor. The ghost of the lady she’s pretending to be on the tour (@missjudygreer) doesn’t like how unladylike she’s behaving so she starts haunting her to get her to act more like a “lady”. My brother and I could not have asked for a kinder, more talented or more game leading lady for @ladyofthemanor. See for yourselves TOMORROW on VOD, @appletv and in select theaters. @poodollar72 and I have selected @bowtiecinemas in Trumbull, CT to watch it on the big screen! Very very excited for you all to see it 👻☺️🙏💛

Before #LadyOfTheManor (out tomorrow!) @msmelanielynskey + I collaborated on 2016’s “Dusk Farts” co-starring child prodigy, Arman Darbo (middle) and our sailing instructor (left) who had more patience than humor - and he had almost no patience. In his defense, this picture was one of our more mature moments of the trip 😬 #tbt

One of my favorite actresses and human beings, the SUBLIME @msmelanielynskey is our latest guest on “Life is Short” podcast! Mel is one of the most truthful people and actors I’ve ever worked with - she’s also quite shy and not great with compliments, so I know she’s bright red right now - a quality that, unfortunately for Mel reading this, only makes her that much more endearing and charming. From her auspicious debut in “Heavenly Creatures” to her scene-stealing work in @mrsam_fxonhulu, Mel is never anything but totally honest and watchable. Like Sam Rockwell and Catherine O’Hara (both of whom she reminds me of), she’s just one of those actors who is UNIVERSALLY admired. She also happens to be the leading lady of #LadyOfTheManor (out this Friday!) in which she plays a stoner/slacker character who does some pretty unsavory things but in Mel’s inherently charming hands, her Hannah is still so likable and easy to root for. Christian and I could not have asked for a more talented or more PATIENT leading lady to bring our first feature to life. We’ll be forever in her (and the equally great @missjudygreer’s) debt. Hear me wax poetic about her and her evenly matched charming husband @jason_ritter (who cameos on this episode as an audio technician who attempts to help Melanie set up her microphone… see pic #2 - Jason is discussing his recently dyed blonde hair while Mel expresses her opinion of Jason’s aesthetic choice - I messed up some of the audio by laughing too hard). If you enjoy this episode HALF as much as I did, you’re in for a great time. Speaking of great times, check out Mel’s next movie “LADY OF THE MANOR” this Friday!!! In select theaters, on demand + @appletv!

The only existing photo that proves Lewis Black, our latest “Life is Short” podcast guest, was at the “Accepted” wrap party (as was @poodollar72 who, appropriately, played a sh*t sandwich - not kidding). Lewis, in addition to playing South Harmon’s Dean of students, is one of the funniest and sharpest people I know. He’s a long-time @thedailyshow correspondent, a great standup comedian, and an accomplished playwright. We talk about his career, working together on “Accepted” and a play, a few years later - we also catch up on life, in general, and he makes fun of me a lot - just like the old days :)
But, like Don Rickles before him, Lew is actually a warm, sensitive person and his jokes are never mean or truly hurtful - which leads to a fun conversation w Christian about the difference between a persona and a personality. Hope you all enjoy! Or, as Lewis might say, before giving a huge eye roll, “oh yeah, they’re chompin’ at the BIT to hear THIS one! Ugh jeez! You couldn’t stick to just being an actor?!?” 🙄❤️
Fresh new haircut (and tan!) for upcoming press to promote #LadyOfTheManor out September 17th in select theaters @appletv @itunes On Demand + streaming in streams and tributaries EVERYWHERE!

When my brother, Christian (@poodollar72)  was born 40 years ago today (!), my parents gave me this Boba Fett action figure as a gift. I wasn’t exactly sure why I was receiving a gift, as it wasn’t MY birthday, but I didn’t question it, at all, because it was the coolest toy I’d ever gotten - why look a gift Boba Fett in the mouth… er helmet mouth guard thingie? I guess they probably did it to soften the blow of having to share my life with a new person - someone they were going to love just as much as they loved me. But ironically, THAT turned out to be the greatest gift (even cooler, incredibly, than a Boba Fett action figure) - getting to share my life with this new person - whether we were…

2… hunting for frogs or 

3… playing “The Last Of The Mohicans” (I made him be the colonial soldier - dressing him in a makeshift uniform, complete with a pail helmet that fit uncomfortably under his nose… he never complained) or 

4… building snowmen or

5… marveling at natural wonders or
 
6… directing and then shamelessly plugging a movie (“Lady of the Manor” out September 17th!) or 

7… doing a weekly podcast (“Life is Short”!) or 

8… eating crabs or

9… cooking dinners or

10… laughing. Laughing so much and so hard. And searching. He’s the funniest, most insightful person I know. 
I still think Boba Fett is pretty cool but… what a gift having a little brother has been ❤️ #ThisIs40
Drinking up every last drop of summer 😌💛

Jeepers Creepers, it’s been 20 years!! 🤯#tbt

If I look surprisingly calm in this picture, it’s because I was… kind of. It was taken as we were waiting in between takes and I remember being so drained from the scene, that I was stealing a moment of calm to try and recharge. Gina (Trish) and I had been avoiding meeting or having any contact with the actor playing The Creeper, Jonathan Breck, throughout the entire shoot, in the hopes that it’d be beneficial to all our performances. For six weeks, we’d been avoiding running into each other - which wasn’t an easy feat on a lower budget movie, shooting in a somewhat remote part of Florida and starring only a handful of actors. If Jonathan was coming to get his lunch at catering, we were quickly shepherded away - if he was in the makeup trailer getting ready, we’d wait somewhere else - and vice versa. When we were shooting the above scene, on our last day of working together, the mechanisms on his face wing things (?) weren’t opening properly and it required several extra takes of this shot where I’m supposed to be as scared as humanly possible. Eventually, I got so tired and it was easier for the crew, trying to get the shot, if I just waited there (rather than walking away to preserve whatever was left of the illusion that we’d spent so long cultivating). Jonathan could tell I was wiped out (I think I even started resting my head gently on his arm that stayed loosely wrapped around my neck) and, at one point, a kind, slightly twangy voice came from inside that hideously sinister face: “You doin’ alright?”
But I didn’t answer. Either I’d gotten so used to not talking to him or I was still trying desperately to pretend he was a monster haha. Or both? I don’t think, looking back, any of those games or tricks made it a better performance - it was probably a total waste of energy and time. But you live and learn and I’m so grateful for all I’ve gotten to live… and continue to learn…

“How ‘bout NO, Scott??” @sethgreen thankfully does not “zip it!” on the latest episode of “Life is Short” podcast. Instead, the young old salty showbiz vet tells some great stories about his (relatively) long acting career - from “Radio Days” to his own INCREDIBLY successful creation @robotchicken! But then, Seth, having spent almost his entire life in entertainment, accomplished something TRULY noteworthy and impressive: he became a kind, grounded person with a surprising amount of perspective and humility. I’ve known Seth for 20 years - he’s ALWAYS treated me and others with respect and good humor. I can’t hardly wait 😬 for you all to listen (which you can, wherever you listen to podcasts)! 
2nd pic… thanks to his lovely wife, Clare, for joining in on The Lightning Round! And check them BOTH out in Seth’s new movie @changelandmovie 🙏❤️

Our latest guest on “Life is Short” podcast @cecilystrong is one of my favorite cast members on SNL + now she’s the author of one of my favorite books “This Will All Be Over Soon” - a beautiful, funny + VERY honest examination of grief, heartbreak and the early days of this pandemic. Cecily has always been so committed and specific in her approach to characters on SNL like “the girl you wish you hadn’t started a conversation with at a party” and even the more utility roles that often get overlooked. In both her acting and writing (and, it turns out, in conversation) she has a very appealing commitment to the truth. I can’t recommend her book enough - especially to anyone struggling with loss (Cecily lost her incredible-sounding cousin just before the Covid lockdown) and I’m grateful for the chance to talk to her about it. You can listen wherever you listen to podcasts! 
Pic 2… finding out that we both love @90dayfiance

The most gorgeous Greek since Aphrodite @johnstamos shows me his natural “resting Blue Steel face” on the latest episode of “Life Is Short” podcast! (While I show him my “resting stoned nerd face”).

The musical legend @dariusrucker (aka “the artist formerly known as Hootie”) politely humors my request to become an honorary blowfish on the latest episode of “Life is Short” podcast.  Darius very kindly indulged my curiosity about where the name “Hootie and the Blowish” came from and  gave an interesting overview of the entire journey of the Grammy-winning, wildly popular 90’s staple. He also tells me about his life growing up as an impoverished but happy, music-loving kid in Charleston, SC. And how he, once again, ignored the odds (and the racist culture) to become one of the most successful solo country music acts today. Despite decades of success in the music industry, I was truly disarmed by how down-to-earth and grateful Darius struck me. He also has not forgotten his roots and gives so much of his time and money to local Charleston charities - some of whom I’ll tag in this photo. It was such a fun, inspiring conversation - one you can hear wherever you listen to podcasts!

Our latest “Life is Short” podcast guest is the deeeelightful Wilmer Eduardo Valderramaaaaa! @wilmervalderrama and I played pals on “That 70’s Show” which was so easy because he was SO welcoming and kind and truly fun to be around. He tells a beautiful (and funny) story about how he came to play Fez and what it was like for him and his family when he first came to America (from Venezuela, just after Chavez’s first coup attempt). Wilmer also discusses his role on the HIT show @ncis_cbs, his latest greatest role (since SUMMER CATCH) as a FATHER, and how, with his new production company, he’s aiming to tell stories about the Hispanic experience - including an incredible-sounding upcoming collaboration with @rodriguez. Stephen Root may not be a household name, unless your household loves great character actors who never give the same performance twice. From the nebbishy stapler-obsessed Milton in OFFICE SPACE to the self-centered assassin Monroe Fuches in BARRY, Stephen’s range as an actor is as wide as they come, which is why he’s always been one of my favorites. On this latest ep of “Life is Short” podcast, Stephen and I reminisce about the DODGEBALL days (he played Gordon Pibb) and some of the other jobs we did together. He also tells some fun stories about his early days, about some of his favorite characters and about how he fell in love with acting (and how iconic directors like the Coen Brothers and @realmikejudge came to fall in love with him). Listen to my catchup with the legendary Stephen Root wherever you listen to podcasts :) 
P.s. I’m surprised there’s no stapler emoji 🤔

Years ago, Frank Oz was directing a movie that the producers had already offered me but Frank felt that another actor would match better with the actress playing my wife. I loved this other actor (Alan Tudyk) and completely understood.  I was only disappointed because I was such a huge fan of Frank Oz’s work. He was responsible for more of my childhood joy than any other single performer - creating iconic characters like Grover, Animal, Bert, Fozzie, Miss Piggy, Cookie Monster... YODA! Not to mention directing classics like THE DARK CRYSTAL, WHAT ABOUT BOB?, DIRTY ROTTEN SCOUNDRELS and BOWFINGER. In my book, he’s one of the greatest of all time. Fortunately, we got to meet and I was able to tell him how much his work has meant to me; how funny and affecting and sometimes terrifying (Sam The Eagle was such an intimidating authority figure that, whenever he’d appear on The Muppet Show, I’d have to literally leave the room). 

As a gift for being understandable about the casting snafu (I think), he sent me this 👆- autographs of some of his most iconic characters, written in their distinct handwriting. It’s probably the coolest thing I own and is prominently displayed in my house - a daily reminder of the huge impact Jim Henson and Frank Oz have had on my life (on so many lives!). Looking at it always makes me happy. I hope it has the same effect on you😌❤️

I instruct Paris Hilton how best to pose for a pic “that’s hot” and tell her about growing up as a wealthy hotel heiress on the latest episode of “Life is Short” podcast! She listens attentively, trying her best to relate to me. 
In all seriousness, I’ve always been intrigued by @parishilton - someone I’ve known for decades, like everyone else, as a ubiquitous figure in pop-culture. After watching the great documentary “This is Paris”, I learned that there was much more to her than had met my eye. Paris opens up about the abuse she suffered at the controversial “disciplinary academy” she involuntarily attended in the 1990’s - a place she recently helped get a bill passed in the Utah Senate to outlaw. We also talk about her ditzy higher-pitched alter ego and how that persona, at one point, got away from her - and, of course, her obsession with animals (especially tiny dogs). Paris has too many things going on to mention but she explains most of them, including her new podcast @thisisparispodcast and @poodollar72 and I reminisce about the summer when we attended enough of Paris’ parties to almost make it to acquaintance-level and we also SHAMELESSLY promote our directorial debut “Lady of The Manor” out Sept 17th courtesy of @lionsgate. Overall, one might say that this episode is... well... hot (“hawt”?) 
Listen wherever you listen to podcasts! Or swipe up in my stories!

As a kid, if I’d ever actually been able to have a conversation with Bugs Bunny or Daffy Duck, my young mind would’ve been blown. Come to find out that, as an adult, that’s still the case...Eric Bauza is (not yet) a household name, but the iconic characters he voices are some of the most famous in history: #WoodyWoodpecker, #BugsBunny, #DaffyDuck, #PussInBoots, #BabyFozzie even #MarvinTheMartian (!!)... the list goes ON. Eric very entertainingly walks me through the mechanics / history of how he mastered some of these voices (he’s even Splinter in “TMNT”), growing up a cartoon-obsessed child in Toronto (🇨🇦❤️), our shared admiration of VO pioneers like Mel Blanc, @hankazaria and @realmikejudge - and Eric shared his views on actors of Asian decent in the voice-animation landscape. This was one of my favorite episodes in the two years (!) we’ve now been doing the show and I can’t thank @bauzilla enough for sharing his time and gifts with us. I’d say “check out his upcoming movie @spacejammovie this July, but everyone is already really looking forward to it (myself included). If you woke up today and thought “I’d like to hear two middle-aged nerds have an ‘ALF-off’🤔” You’re in luck! Listen to me and @poodollar72 turn into awe-struck children on “Life is Short” wherever you listen to podcasts or swipe up in my story! 🐰

Attention, fellow nerds! Our latest “Life is Short” podcast guest is director and Nerd Lord, #ZackSnyder! (Maybe if I imitate Zack’s exact hand gestures, I’ll also be a great director someday! Or if I laugh extra hard at his jokes?)
 Zack IS surprisingly funny (considering some of the movies he’s made: “300”, “Batman vs Superman”, “Dawn of the Dead”) and very surprisingly down-to-earth (considering how celebrated he is). We talk about his latest “Justice League” cut on @hbomax as well as his upcoming “Army of The Dead” on @netflix (which looks AMAZING and stars friend-o-the-show @davebautista). We also talk about Zack’s early days, his disdain for @poodollar72 + my favorite superhero movie (Superman III) and the tragic family event that lead to Zack initially stepping away from “Justice League”. In addition to honoring his daughter, Autumn, by ultimately finishing the movie, thanks to a social media outcry, Zack and his supporters have done a huge amount of fundraising and awareness-spreading for #SuicidePrevention (go, Nerds! 🤓💪) - so please check out @afsp and how to contribute to “the Autumn Snyder Tribute Fund” in my stories

As you can see, we do a lot of both in this ep - from his experience growing up as a biracial child in an almost all white Montana town and spending summers in a mostly black Ohio neighborhood, to finding his very unique artistic voice in the grunge/alt Seattle 90’s and how he ended up as the bandleader/comedic muse/sidekick on @latelateshow w @j_corden - I’ve always been curious where/HOW somebody as interesting and unique as Reggie came to exist. His stories did not disappoint.

It’s been such an enjoyable part of our lives so thank you to everyone whose been listening to “Life is Short” - and if you haven’t yet but have even the SLIGHTEST bit of curiosity, you can listen wherever you listen to podcasts - for FREE! As far back as I can remember, I’ve been in awe of Dr Jane Goodall. As a kid who loved @natgeo magazine and watched every nature show our 13 channels offered, Dr Goodall seemed like a real life Dr Doolittle (one of my favorite books). I still can’t believe I got to spend some time with her on the latest episode of “Life is Short” podcast. I can’t believe she identified the emotion in the noise my cheesy monkey banana holder makes. I can’t believe she let me call her “Jane”. I can’t believe I didn’t immediately make a bad Tarzan joke. And, most of all, I can’t believe how lucky we are to have such a wise, beautiful soul help us better understand how to take proper care of our planet and the other primates with whom we share it. It was a deeply moving experience getting to connect with her and feel the sense of hope she has for the next generation of earthly custodians. A great source of this hope is her own inspirational charitable organization @rootsandshoots - which is giving the next generation of possible Dr Goodalls the tools with which to, hopefully, save the planet and our fellow primates. Please listen to our episode of “Life is Short” wherever you get your podcasts and, more importantly, listen to Jane’s own podcast, appropriately named #Hopecast 😌🐒✌️

I always knew Louie Anderson, our latest “Life is Short” podcast guest, was very funny but I was surprised to discover he’s also incredibly warm and empathetic. Though they sometimes delight in my physical pain, the kids at @girlshomenica are turning into impressive young women, despite having been brought up in very difficult conditions (extreme poverty and, sometimes, horrible physical and psychological abuse). Thanks to incredible women like @collingwood_rachel and the selfless nuns (Sor Ligia + Sor Ester) who run the home and to people like YOU for your continued financial help (link in my bio) young women like Joceling and Deborah are defying the odds and realizing their full potential. Recent graduate, Joceling, for example, is going to fulfill her dream of being a pharmacist - a dream that, without the safety and education provided by the Girl’s Home, would’ve been impossible to realize. So thank you for continuing to give, so that these young women can continue to thrive. And happy #InternationalWomensDay! 🙏❤️💃🏼

Charmed and fascinated by our charming and fascinating “life is short” podcast guest, Jeff Corwin! Listen as I desperately seek @wildcorwin’s approval and he regales us with incredible conservation stories about the Golden Frog in Panama, the black-footed ferret in the Midwest, the giant salamander in Japan and lessons we need to learn from less fortunate species - and how, after losing 60% of our natural resources, we can protect the remainder. He also tells harrowing stories of being bitten by a deadly corral snake, flung around by an elephant, surviving a coup d’etate in Cambodia and being married for 28 years! And, not to bury the lead, he’s got a GREAT Massachusetts accent😍 Listen to me nerd out wherever you listen to podcasts (or swipe up in my stories) 🤓🐢🐸🐘

I met Brian today. He was fishing by the side of the road that runs through the Everglades. He had a great thick southern drawl and was one of the most genial and contented-seeming people I’ve ever met. He told me he can sit and fish for up to 12 hours, perfectly happy. “It’s a lot cheaper than therapy,” he said, chuckling. I asked him if he ever fished into the night and he said his friends insist that he not do that alone as it can be dangerous. “Right, because of all the alligators in the area”, I assumed. “Naw, THEY don’t bother you...” he gave me a leading stare.  I quickly realized he was talking about other humans - specifically racist humans. It was a reminder that strangers you can meet can really run across a wide spectrum of humanity... I just gotta believe that most are closer on that spectrum to the Brians of the world than to anyone who’d want to cause somebody like him harm 🙏❤️

Our Grandma Jody passed away this morning. I’m not really able to write about her in the past tense yet, except to say that she was one of my favorite people and I’m really gonna miss hanging out with her. My brother and I are so grateful to all of you who’ve sent her well wishes since she was on the podcast. She got such a kick out of the fact that anybody had heard it and had gotten to know her a little bit - so thank you for that. But to know her now is to miss her always. I guess that’s the best legacy any of us can hope for. I’ve been thinking a lot today about that great Beatles line “and in the end, the love you take is equal to the love you make”. She is taking a LOT of love to wherever she’s going next :)

It’s been seven years since Phil passed away. Years before that, in the early 2000’s, we were in a crowded restaurant (El Compadre on Sunset Blvd) and Phil was telling a really funny story about an embarrassing thing that had happened to him. Rather than lean in and whisper the most embarrassing part to us, so as to spare himself the shame of onlookers judgement, he stood up from the table and committed to a full-body mime of it, while laughing his great big wheezy laugh. As funny as it was, I immediately became a little self conscious on his behalf and looked around the restaurant to see people’s reactions. Phil was an acting god to me so I just assumed everyone recognized him but even if they didn’t, they were now staring at him - he was laughing so hard his face had turned pink and his eyes were watering. But what struck me most about Phil, in that moment, was how unaware he was of anything outside the story he was telling and the people he was telling it to - he lived that moment the way he lived every moment as an actor: fully present and committed and without a hint of self consciousness. It was beautiful - something I’ll never forget and always aspire to. 
I can’t wait to have another night out with friends at a place like El Compadre, telling stories and laughing - but I don’t think I’ll ever have a night quite like that one, because nobody tells stories or laughs with quite as much abandon as Phil did 😌❤️

I love this tree.  It’s been leaning out over this little sandy hill since I was a kid. During the summers, I’d spend countless hours at its base fishing for bluegills or catching bullfrogs. Over the years, erosion has exposed more of its network of gnarly roots, making it look even more sinister on a day like this - but every time I go visit, I’m always a little relieved to find it still growing there - watching over those warm childhood memories on its precarious sandy perch :)
Thanks to #TheBarkingLot + @mv_reed we each got fresh new haircuts ✂️😎

When I got to work with Alan Rickman on “Galaxy Quest”, I was a VERY wide-eyed young actor doing my very first movie. It spoiled me. It gave me the false impression that all great actors were like Alan. He treated everyone the same. He always sat and ate his lunch with the crew. He’d stay and do off-camera for the other actors even if he was just giving them “a look” in the scene. He was equally generous with his downtime, letting me and Jeremy Howard pick his brain like hungry young acting vultures. He had an unbelievably funny and dark sense of humor but his delivery was often so dry that if you weren’t present enough to catch his subtle rhythms or the faint mischievous gleam in his eye, you might think he was being a stuffy misanthrope. The thing that amazed me most about him was that, in those instances, he’d never make it clear he WAS joking! It was something that required real social courage and a commitment that I doubt I’ll ever possess but will always aspire to. I saw this happen to a few high-powered executives that sat down at lunch to put in some time with him (while ignoring other “lower status” people at the table). When they got up to leave, a little weirded out and uncomfortable, Alan gave me a sly knowing grin. I loved that moment - I loved others that I don’t remember as well. I loved him. This is a picture from the wrap party where Alan, this classically trained master British thespian, partied so much harder than anyone else. He passed away 5 years ago today. I didn’t know him well but  I still think about him all the time. 
I did a play, years later, that he had been doing for many months and had just voluntarily left, replaced by another actor. But he still came to see me in my opening night. He left flowers and a card with a message inside that still makes me smile so big. On the front of the card was a beautiful sunset with fancy font cursive letters that just said “Fuck You” 😌 #tbt

We shot most of “Waiting” outside of New Orleans in an actual Bennigans that had recently shut down. Most of us were 20-something yr old actors who’d (almost) all worked in actual restaurants only a few years earlier, so we were familiar with that smell that is totally unique to restaurant kitchens - anyone whose worked in one knows what I’m talking about. I think it helped us all feel like we were right back there - it made it easier to bond with each other over this shared “return” to restaurant work/life and it helped us relive some of the more pride-swallowing moments of waiting on people who could be... entitled turds. But, unlike the restaurants I’d worked in, there wasn’t a single member of this staff that I didn’t really enjoy working with (even @davidkoechner! 😉😘). To say we had fun with that crew in that city is a pretty big understatement 😌🦇 
#fbf 

Over the years, restaurant/bar workers have often said that the movie resonates with them (which is always nice to hear). I know that people in that industry have been especially hard hit by the economic fall-out from covid-19, so for the rest of January, if you order a @cameo from me, all the money will go to @southernsmoketx which provides financial and mental health support to people in the food and beverage industry in need. I got very lucky when I became an actor but I know if I hadn’t, I’d probably be among them. Thanks also to everyone who supported @rednosedayusa ✌️

Happy 104th bday to the OG - Grandma Jody! 
She was born before the Spanish Flu pandemic, before the electric refrigerator and the pop-up toaster were invented, before self-serving supermarkets, before the world’s first billionaire existed, before Nathan Handweker sold the first Nathan’s hotdog at Coney Island, before we entered World War ONE, before Woodrow Wilson sent troops to pursue Pancho Villa into Mexico, before Fitzgerald wrote “The Great Gatsby” and James Joyce wrote “Ulysses”, before hearing aids and frozen food were invented, before daylight savings time went into effect and, as you can see, long long LONG before there was a “selfie”.... or hashtags or #fbf

I can’t think of a better way to end a long “Life is Short” year than getting to know the VERY fun-to-know @alisonbrie! I now completely understand why my friend and her “Glow” co-star Betty Gilpin said she was “probably the most comfortable in her own skin person I’ve ever met”. It’s not often that you’re comparing pit stains with someone (REGARDLESS of gender!) within the first 30 minutes of meeting them. In addition to our sweaty pits, we discuss other important matters like her ideal snack, her recently neutered cat and testicles, in general. In between all of this cerebral high-brow chat, we do talk about Allison’s admirable acting career, including her latest INCREDIBLE film @promisingyoungwoman (I saw it over a week ago and can’t stop thinking about it). It’s ironic to me that Allison IS so comfortable in her own skin because I’ve always thought she was SO good at inhabiting the skin of others - which is either a really pretentious or REALLY disgusting thing to say. Anyway, I’m now no longer just a fan of her acting - and I’m not just saying all this because she listens to the show or because... it’s her BIRTHDAY! Happy birthday @alisonbrie! And thank you to all the “LIS podcast” fans for listening this year (even if it was purely by accident)! ❤️🙏😘

Legendary wrestler-turned Hollywood movie star-turned my friend @davebautista (he’s the one on top - we are ALWAYS getting confused for one another🤦🏻‍♂️) is our guest on the latest episode of “Life is Short” podcast! The only thing bigger than Dave’s body is his sense of compassion and humility - he is such an endearing combination of physically intimidating and emotionally sensitive. We talk about how this juxtaposition happened, when it’s both helped and complicated his life, and how a mixed race kid who grew up in abject poverty in the crime-ridden Washington DC of the 1980’s became one of the biggest stars in the world. If you could use a brush up on that ever important lesson “don’t judge a book by it’s cover”, listen to this episode. Me and my first dog, Moose. He was as disobedient and horny as he was adorable... and I loved him (most of the time). 

One day, when he was playing in the yard belonging to the family of my girlfriend (at the time), he disappeared.  Her other dogs remained but Moose was nowhere to be found. Panicked, we ran around her neighborhood (between Koreatown and Hancock Park in LA) scouring the streets and yards. Nothing. We put up signs offering a substantial reward (probably too substantial, in retrospect, but we were desperate and not thinking clearly). The next day I got a call from a man who said they’d found our dog. I had just started to eagerly thank him when he interrupted me to coldly ask “So, can I get that reward money in cash?” In my excited relief, I’d forgotten about the reward and, more importantly, how substantial we’d made it. Red flags went off by how blunt and inconsiderate his tone was. I told him I could get half in cash and would he accept the rest in check form. “Uh... no, it’s gonna have to be all cash”, he responded. More red flags. I could’ve opened a whole red flag store, if that weren’t too niche a thing and not at-all sustainable from a business perspective. I agreed to get him cash and we set a time to meet up.... 
*TO BE CONTINUED (I just realized how long this story is 🤦🏻‍♂️) #tbt

Some “Crossroads” memories...
I remember being slightly nervous to work with Britney Spears - she was such a massive star in 2002 (as she still is). When she introduced herself to me in the makeup trailer, I was disarmed by how sweet and NOT famous she seemed - just a nice girl (not yet a woman) from Louisiana. She immediately made me feel comfortable, as did Tamra Davis (the director) and @shondarhimes (the writer - p.s. what ever happened to HER???) and, despite having a small part, I felt encouraged to play around and improvise a bit - such a great working environment (they even let me blatantly rip off one of my favorite scenes from “Take the money and Run”). I was also excited to work with Eric Edwards who shot some of my favorite Gus Van Sant movies like “My Own Private Idaho” and “To Die For” (we worked together again a few years later on “The Breakup”) 
Britney seemed to get exponentially more tense (totally understandably) whenever we walked off set with her bodyguard “Big something” (my memory is so bad but I remember really liking him - a massive, warm, friendly, terrifying guy). People would clamor to get to her and paparazzi were constantly lurking behind trees, in bushes, etc. 
Years later, when the tabloid frenzy surrounding Britney reached a fever pitch, I remember feeling so sorry for her. Nobody deserves to be hounded and harassed like that - least of all a very sweet person - one who behaved kindly towards a young nervous actor who occupied a much lower rung on the hierarchical ladder of that film set. 
I also loved the casting directors @kimdaviswag + @justinearteta so much. Justine was such a present + connected reader, she’d make it so much easier to be present and connected yourself. 
When I saw the movie, I remember thinking that it looked like I was wearing pantyhose on my head because the makeup people only put makeup on my pasty white face and failed to cover up the rest of my translucent body (probably because it would’ve gotten all over the sheets🤢). Though I personally think it makes Britney’s skin tone look that much nicer - and she was the star, after all, despite not acting like one :) #tbt

Rather than gift-wrapping your donations (which will be MATCHED today!) it’s MUCH easier to go to rednoseday.org/FullPlate

$2​ can help provide one hot meal for homeless young people.
$10 ​can feed a child after school for two weeks. OR $10 can provide hot meals for five homeless young people.
$20​ can feed a child after school for a month.
$25​ can provide at least seven healthy meals to a child.

Our guest on the latest ep of “Life is Short” podcast is one of my all time favorite comedians and comedic actors. When I was falling in love with sketch comedy in college (shout out “Laughingstock”!), David Cross’s groundbreaking “Mr Show with Bob and David” and his subsequent comedy albums became my roadmap for what was funny. His comedic point of view was essential in shaping my own. I attempt to resist articulating this to him while we talk about his fantastic new movie #TheDarkDivide, his 25+ year acting/comedy career and, of COURSE, his experience playing my nemesis (Ian) in 3 “Alvin and the Chipmunks” movies (or “FILMS”). David has such a fertile and impressive brain, it was SUCH a treat to get to pick it for a bit. I hope you all enjoy our good ol’ fashioned brain pickin’ too! Our latest guest on “Life is Short” podcast is the talented and DELIGHTFUL @kat.mcnamara! She also happens to be the youngest guest we’ve ever had (unless our mutual friend @beaniefeldstein challenges this) BUT she’s definitely not the most immature (prob a tie between @lamorne and @iammaxgreenfield). Katherine talks about, among other things: growing up as a theatre + math-loving only child in Missouri (and helps me with my accent), the origins of the several nicknames that have been bestowed on her, how she found herself on Broadway with legends Elaine Stritch + Bernadette Peters at the tender age of 14(!), her upcoming @cbsallaccess series Stephen King’s The Stand (which looks SO GOOD) and her involvement with @bigslickkc - a great event started by other funny and generous Kansas City natives Paul Rudd, @davidkoechner and @robriggle (among others - I only named the ones that personally owe me money). Kat’s also actively involved w @24hourplays and several anti-bullying campaigns. As a YA + @thecw mainstay, a lot of young people like the characters she’s played, so it’s nice to see her own character seems worthy of their admiration too! I hope you all enjoy our talk :)

My guest today on “Life is short” podcast is my beloved PC; my favorite acting partner and dear friend @johnhodgman. A job for @apple brought us together but his great wit, kind heart and ability to stand talking to me for hours on end against a stark white background, insured that we’d be friends long after that computer campaign ended (in 2010). I do enough gushing about John in today’s podcast, so I’ll censor myself here but let me just say, of all the innovative, significant things that Steve Jobs did, the one I’ll always be most grateful for is John’s friendship (as I type this on an iPhone). I could not admire his great big beautiful brain more, not to mention his generous heart and impeccable taste in cheddar-based puffy snacks. In the mid 2000’s my mother was diagnosed with cancer, it was, obviously, a very scary time - one that tests the strength of friendships (thankfully, she eventually made a full recovery🙏). I asked John if he’d cohost a benefit with me for the cancer ward at Yale New Haven hospital and thinking about how quickly and unflinchingly he responded to that request makes me emotional to this day.  If you’ve never listened to an episode of this podcast, I’d recommend you start with this one. He’s just the best. And the irony is he knows SO much more about computers than I do! (So much more about EVERYTHING...except maybe sports 😬)
Check out his great podcast “Judge John Hodgman”, his HILARIOUS book “Medallion Status” and his both great AND hilarious animated show “Dick Town” on @hulu (John would’ve come up with MUCH better adjectives for those). But first, enjoy our most recent catch-up...
And @pmorrison10 (our intrepid director for that campaign) - you were there in spirit 😘
